Este será su cuarto  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel A. Araya is a 47 year old woman who lives with her husband and daughter in the small community called La Trinchera de Pital in Alajuela Province. The main activities of the region are livestock production and agriculture, with an emphasis on the cultivation of pineapples that are sold primarily to international markets. For this reason, community development has increased in recent years and has generated more demand for goods and services by providing more job opportunities.

Doña María is dedicated to agriculture. At the moment she is growing cassava, a tuber that has a pleasant flavor and is rich in nutrients. Agro-industrial processing of this crop has increased because demand is great in Costa Rica and in other countries.

Doña María is currently requesting a loan of 600,000 CRC to increase her harvest. This will help with preparing the land for planting by purchasing seeds, fertilizers, composts, and other supplies that are necessary to ensure an optimum output. With this investment, she hopes for a good harvest that produces a product with the appropriate features that will command a higher sales price. The start of a successful project will allow her to improve the conditions for her family.

Doña María is a member of Communal Enterprise of the Successful Women of La Trinchera de Pital, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her fourth loan and she hopes to continue growing personally and financially. She also actively participates in her local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of her farmland for growing cassava

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta González Velázquez  es una señora de 51 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus 2  hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Doña  Marta y su familia   se han dedicado  toda su vida  a la agricultura, especialmente se ha interesado en el engorde de cerdos para su venta. Ella dice que nunca ha tenido su propio negocio y que  su situación económica la ha  motivo a buscar otros ingresos para mantener a sus hijos en la estudiando y mejorar su calidad de  vida.

Ella  desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢665000 (seiscientos sesenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar más cerdos y mejorar las condiciones de cuido e Infraestructura. Con este préstamo espera abastecer la demanda de carne de cerdo que hay en su comunidad y así  hacer crecer poco a poco su negocio hasta llegar hacer una microempresaria exitosa

Doña Marte es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo  y con el espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos. Asegura que este tipo de organización motivan a las personas para  seguir adelante y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Marta González Velázquez is a 51 year old woman who lives with her husband and two children in a community called Santa Fe, which is located in Los Chiles, Alajuela Province. The community is situated in a mountainous area near the northern border of the country. The main economic activities are ranching and farming, with specific emphasis on the cultivation of grains, sugar cane, and oranges.

Doña Marta and her family have dedicated their entire lives to agriculture. She is especially interested in fattening pigs to sell. Doña Marta never had her own business and her situation motivated her to look for other sources of income to support her children with their studies and improve their quality of life.

She wants to obtain a microloan in the amount of 665,000 CRC to purchase more pigs and improve the infrastructure for raising them. With this loan she hopes to meet the demand for pork in her community. In doing so, she hopes to increase her business gradually so that she becomes a successful micro-entrepreneur.

Doña Marte is a member of the Manantial de Santa Fe Communal Credit Enterprise, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan and she hopes to improve her quality of life and that of her children. She says that these types of organizations motivate people to succeed and improve their position in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs & improve the conditions raising them

loans.name: Alexander Rojas Molina

texts.es:
Alexander R. M. es  un señor  de 33 años de edad quien vive con su madre  en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

Don Alexander se dedica a la agricultura, en estos momentos el se dedica a la siembra de yuca, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros países.

Actualmente Don Alexander está solicitando un préstamo de ¢400000 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para ampliar su siembra y así ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del ñame. 
Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto. Con esto desea iniciar un proyecto exitoso que le permita ayudar a su madre la cual depende solo de el y se encuentra muy enferma. 


El es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Alexander R. M. is a 33 year old gentleman who lives with his mother in the small community of La Trinchera de Pital in Alajuela Province. The main activities of the region are livestock production and agriculture, with an emphasis on the cultivation of pineapples that are sold primarily to international markets. For this reason, community development has increased in recent years and has generated more demand for goods and services by providing more job opportunities.

Don Alexander is a farmer. At the moment he is devoted to growing cassava, a tuber that has a pleasant flavor and is rich in nutrients. Agro-industrial processing of this crop has increased because demand is great in Costa Rica and in other countries.

Don Alexander is currently requesting a loan of 400,000 CRC to increase his harvest. This will help with preparing the land for planting by purchasing seeds, fertilizers, composts, and other supplies that are necessary to ensure an optimum output. With this investment, he hopes for a good harvest that produces a product with the appropriate features that will command a higher sales price. The start of a successful project will allow him to help his mother because she is solely dependent on him and very ill.

Don Alexander is a member of the Communal Enterprise of the Successful Women of La Trinchera de Pital, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and financially. He also actively participates in his local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of his farmland for growing cassava

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is from the city of Vehari, in Pakistan. She has a three-roomed house in which she has lived with her family for the past 25 years. Her husband, M. B., has a fruit-selling business. He buys fruits from the fruit markets and supplies them to fruit shops in order to generate an income. His earnings are the main source of his family's income.
Zarina is a very kind lady who handles her children with care. She gets up early and gets her children (three sons and one daughter) ready for school. She then arranges the fruits on her husband's cart and after that completes the domestic chores.
Zarina is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits in bulk to expand her husband’s fruit-selling business so that he is able to earn a good income and meet the financial needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits in bulk

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is from the city of Vehari in Pakistan. She has a three-roomed house where she has lived with her family for the past 20 years. She is a friendly-natured woman whom her neighbors like to meet. She warmly meets with them and treats them with care and respect.
Sakina's husband, M. S., operates a business selling quilts and blankets. He sells these two items both in the cloth markets and in the community. Once a month he travels to different cities (Lahore and Faisalabad) to purchase quilts and blankets because the prices are cheap there and the items are good quality. Sakina is requesting a loan to expand her husband’s business so that he is able to buy quilts and blankets in bulk and increase his sales.

loans.use: To buy quilts and blankets in bulk

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a wife of M. J. and they both live in the mid-sized city of Vehari in Pakistan. They have a three-roomed house in which they have been living for the past 25 years. Khursheed's husband operates a blanket-selling business. He purchases his blankets in two cities (Lahore and Faisalabad) because of the cheap prices and great quality. He sells the blankets to different shops and markets and earns a good profit. His profit allows him to pay for utilities and meet his family's financial expenses. His earnings are the only source of family income.
Khursheed is requesting a loan to buy blankets in bulk to expand her husband’s business so that he is able to earn a good profit and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy blankets in bulk

loans.name: Bbogo Women's Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en:
B. Henry, shown with a raised hand, is an enterprising 24-year-old divorced retail business owner in Nkumbwe landing site, Lugazi district. He has one child who unfortunately does not attend school.

Henry has been plying his business for the last two years and he mainly deals in sugar, maize flour and beans. Currently his business generates him profits to the tune of 100,000 Ugandan shillings, per month. His small scale retail business is his only source of income. Most of his customers are fishermen from the neighboring villages.

Henry says that, with this loan, he will be in a position to rejuvenate his business which has been plagued by losses due to the unpredictable change in customers’ preferences. He became involved in this business after he saw that no-one had a retail shop in his locality. He plans on educating his only child and buying more merchandise for his retail business after he gets this loan.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour, beans and so on and to educate his child

loans.name: Kamuli A Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
K. Moses, shown in the photo with his hand on his hat, is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is a hardworking man who sells produce in Nyenge center, Lugazi, to meet his family’s requirements. The humorous 36-year-old has six kids who all go to school.

In a week, Moses reportedly makes 100,000 shillings out of his ten-year-old enterprise. With the loan he plans to purchase supplementary produce and to educate his kids even further. He sells beans, maize, coffee and millet to retail shop owners and employs one person in his business.

At first, Moses was employed by someone else in the same business, from which he got experience to do his own business. Moses is a polite, respectable man and a leader. His dream is to see all his children attend the best education.

loans.use: To buy more beans, maize, coffee and millet and to educate his children

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Este Sr. Se llama Francisco Javier C. Pérez, tiene 42 años de edad, casado, Obrero, él labora en la Alcaldía de su municipio, habita en una comunidad Rural que se llama Valle Las Mayorga, lugar de donde él también es originario al igual que su esposa, tiene tres hijos, dos mujeres y un varón, ellos están cursando la escuela secundaría y primaria.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de tres créditos, los que le han servido para realizar gastos personales y este último para mejorar su vivienda, vale mencionar que en los tres créditos otorgados anteriormente a este cliente ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Javier is 42 years old, married, and a worker. He works for the mayor's office of his municipality and lives in a rural community called Valle Las Mayorga. He and his wife are from there originally. They have 3 children, 2 girls and a boy, who are in secondary and primary school. He has had a total of 3 loans with our institution, which he has used for personal expenses, and the most recent, for making improvements on his house. It's worth mentioning that during these 3 previous loans, this client has been very responsible with his obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MATERIALS TO IMPROVE HIS HOUSE: BLOCKS, ZINC SHEETING, CEMENT, SAND AND NAILS

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is a wife of T. H. and lives in the mid-sized city of Vehari in Pakistan. She has a two-roomed house in which she has lived with her family for the past 25 years. She owns and operates a decorative embroidery business. She prepares embroidered dresses and sells them in the clothes markets. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband.
Nusrat's husband operates a bangle-selling business. He sells bangles by going to different areas with his cart and announcing his products in a loud voice to attract customers. He sells a variety of bangles, such as steel bangles and colored bangles. He has been in this business for over five years. Currently, he receives an order from bangle shops, which is a great opportunity for him to earn a good income. Therefore, Nusrat is requesting a loan to buy bangles in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bangles in bulk to sell

loans.name: Maroofan's Group

texts.en:
Maroofan is a widow. Her husband died four years ago of a heart attack. She did everything possible to save his life but it was all in vain in front of God’s will. He left her without financial resources, but she fights with the circumstance bravely to overcome it.
  
She started operating a bangle-selling business. First she went door-to-door to reach out and obtain clients in various places. But now she has obtained a good number of customers. Her selling is not limited to the community but it has gone out of the community as well. She receives orders from the bangle shops too and earns good profit. 

Her family consists of five children: three sons and two daughters. She does this work to give them a good future. She is requesting a loan to expand her bangle-selling business so she gives her children a better future and fulfills their desired needs.

loans.use: To buy bangles in bulk to sell

loans.name: Kigunda Group 2, Rukungiri

texts.en:
T. Joseph is a hardworking and devoted man. He is 38 years old and married with three children aged 15, 13 and 9 years (2 boys and 1 girl) and all in primary school.

Joseph has a grocery business where he grows and sells fruits and vegetables like cabbages, dodo (leafy greens of the amaranth plant), oranges and so on and sells to traders in the markets as well as sometimes selling the produce in the markets himself.

Joseph has been in the business for three years and he is grateful that his business is growing tremendously, partly due to his hard work and partly with the help of loans. Joseph needs a loan to be able to buy more fertilizer and high-quality seedlings for business improvement.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and high quality seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Bruno Flavio

texts.es:
Este Sr. Se llama Bruno Flavio Poveda, tiene 36 años de edad, soltero, es obrero, trabaja en la Alcaldía del municipio de Posoltega, él habita en una comunidad Rural que se llama los Zanjones número tres, lugar de donde es originario, tiene cuatro hijos, una mujercita y tres varones, de ellos dos están cursando la escuela secundaría y dos la primaria, él curso únicamente hasta tercer grado de primaria

Con nuestra institución es el primer crédito que está obteniendo.
texts.en:
This is Bruno. He is 36 years old and single. He works as a laborer for the Posoltega city hall. He is originally from and currently lives in a rural community called “Zanjones número tres” (Zanjones Number Three). He has four children, three sons and one daughter. Two of them are attending junior high school and two are in elementary school. Bruno himself only completed the third grade. This will be his first loan through our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Piglets

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en: Sakina is a wife of M. B. and lives in a city named Vehari, in Pakistan. She is a very active lady. She stays at home and takes care of her family and manages the domestic chores efficiently. Her husband is involved in a fruit selling business. His earnings are the main source of income for his family, which forces him to work hard to meet their financial needs. He purchases fruit from fruit markets and supplies fruit shops. Currently, Sakina is requesting a loan to open a fruit shop in the community so her husband can sell fruit for his own shop and get more profit from it.

loans.use: To start their own fruit shop

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a skillful lady who lives in a city named Vehari, in Pakistan. She makes embroidered dresses and sells to the cloth shops, generating income for her family. She learned this art from her mother, who conveyed the techniques to her, and this is the result—that she can complete an embroidered dress very easily.

Her husband's name is M. R., and he is an electrician but sells electric supplies as well. He has his own electric shop in the market. For the purpose of diversifying his business, Mumtaz is requesting a loan so he can buy the required items (wires, tube lights, and switches).

loans.use: To purchase electric supplies to sell

loans.name: Williams Antonio

texts.es:
Este cliente es un productor de plátanos de la zona de Tonalá es hombre soltero padre de 1 hijo 
Este cliente aparte de ser productor es maestro de educación primaria pero con el bajo salario no puede sufragar los gastos por lo que esta solicitando este crédito
texts.en:
This gentleman raises bananas in the Tonalá zone. He is single and has one son. Aside from being a farmer, he also teaches elementary school, but can’t afford to defray expenses, so he is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain banana crop

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia operates a clothes sewing business. She sews women's clothing specifically. She has set charges for every kind of dress. For designer clothes, she asks for 150 PKR, and for simple stitching she demands only 100 PKR. The ladies of her community approach her because she returns the clothes on time and stitches their suits well.

Her husband operates a strainer-selling business. He supplies utensil sellers and generates profit. He sells both steel and plastic strainers. Now he wants to diversify his range of products with plastic utensils. Razia is applying for a loan for her husband’s business so he can purchase plastic utensils (plates, glasses, and jugs) in large quantities to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase plastic utensils to sell

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina, de 28 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, Segundo de 30 años, quien trababa en una minera en otra ciudad y viene a casa cada 15 días. También están con ella sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea dar una buena educación, ya que siente que esa es su responsabilidad.

Los largos días de trabajo en sus tierras han logrado que se vuelva una gran conocedora de la agricultura, sus cultivos están muy bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta de sus productos. Aunque tiene que cuidar prácticamente sola a sus hijos, se da tiempo para realizar todas las tareas que una madre tan dedicada como ella debe cumplir, entre las que se encuentran velar por la salud, alimentación y educación de sus hijos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar la tierra, ya que es la actividad que realiza desde que era niña, lleva 9 años como agricultora y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de Tarma. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así incrementar su producción.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Delfina con MFP y está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará un motocarro para que su esposo haga transporte de pasajeros en la ciudad y así pueda estar más cerca de su familia.
texts.en:
Delfina is 28 years old. She is a hardworking and honest young woman who lives in her own home with her husband Segundo, who is 30 years old and works as a miner in another city and comes home every 15 days. Also with her are her three beloved children for whom she wants to provide a good education. She feels that it is her responsibility.

Delfina works long days in her fields and has become an expert in farming. Her crops are well cared for and always command a good price when she sells them. Although she practically has to take of her children by herself, she makes time to perform all the duties that a mother has to do such as making sure that her children are healthy, well-fed, and educated.

What she enjoys most about her work is cultivating the land, an activity that she has been doing since she was a girl. Delfina has been a farmer for nine years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to the market in Tarma. Over time she hopes to buy more land so that she can increase her production.

This is her third loan with MFP. Delfina is saving so that she can complete her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the members of her Communal Bank, where she feels very happy. With the loan of 3000 PEN that she requested, Delfina will buy a motorcycle taxi for her husband so that he can transport passengers to the city and be closer to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle taxi for her husband

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia, a sus 55 años es madre D. 10 hijos, pero solo vive con uno D. ellos, puesto que los demás ya tienen sus propias familias. Ella vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad D. vida.

Trabajando arduamente ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus papas, alverjas y maíz, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad D. Tarma, ya que es ahí donD. obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que pueD. disfrutar D. la libertad D. laborar en sus campos, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra, ya que su esposo falleció hace 10 años y ella tiene que realizar el sembrado y cosechado sola. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado D. alverja, ya que por estas fechas es el producto que mejor se venD..

Este es el octavo préstamo D. Felicia con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo D. su negocio, es por eso que está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida.

Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más semillas D. papa y alverja, para sembrar en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Felicia, at 55 is the mother of 10 children, but she only lives with one of them, as the others already have their own families. She lives in her own house and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life. She has managed to get out her crops by working hard. Early every morning she gets up to water and care for the potatoes, peas and corn which are sold in the city of Tarma, where she gets the best prices for her products. What she likes best about her work is that she can enjoy the freedom of working in the fields. She has been doing this work for 25 years and considers working the land alone to be the hardest part since the death of her husband 10 years ago. Over time, she hopes to prepare the land for planting more peas, since they are the best selling product at this time. This is the eighth loan for Felicia with MFP. She knows that this loan will help tremendously in advancing and developing her business, that's why she will pay all loan dues on time. She is a very responsible member of her community bank and well liked. With the twenty-five hundred new soles she will buy more seed for potatoes and peas, to plant this season.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix, de 35 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y sencillo. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Dina de 35 años, quien trabaja atendiendo su tienda de abarrotes, y con sus 3 hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Muy temprano por la mañana, Félix sale a trabajar sus tierras que se encuentran a una hora de caminata, tiene sembrado gladiolos, alverja y lechuga, cultivos que cuida con mucho cariño y esfuerzo, ya que sabe que de la buena cosecha que obtenga dependerá el sustento económico con el que cuente su familia. Paralelamente a esta actividad, su esposa tiene una tienda de abarrotes, la cual también ayuda en generar ingresos para su familia.
Lo que más le gusta a Félix de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos, es por eso que nunca se olvidad de fumigar sus tierras. En el futuro, desea comprar un carro con el cual el mismo pueda transportar sus productos.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Félix con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que ya está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas. Él es de los pocos varones de su banco comunal, motivo por el cual siempre trata de ser responsable y respetuoso con sus compañeras.

Con la mitad del dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes, con el resto implementará mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Félix is 35 years old and is a very hardworking and humble husband and father. He lives in his own home with his wife Dina, 35, who works in a grocery store. He also lives with his 3 children, who are the reason for all his hard work. Very early in the morning, Felix goes out to work his land that is an hour away on foot. He grows gladiolas, peas and lettuce. He attends to these crops with much affection and work. He knows that the financial support his family needs depends on getting a good harvest. While he is doing this activity, his wife has a grocery store which also helps generate income for the family. What Felix likes the most about his work is planting his fields. He has been doing this activity for 15 years. He considers the most difficult thing to be protecting his crops from the diseases that can affect them. This is why he never forgets to fumigate his land. In the future, he wants to buy a car with which he can transport his products. This is the fourth loan Felix has had with MFP. He doesn't want to stop making payments for lack of money, so he is already saving to make his payments. He is one of a few men in his communal bank, and because of this he always tries to be responsible and respectful with the female members. Half of what he is asking for he will invest in fertilizers. the rest he will use to improve their grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos es un padre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su conyuge y sus 3 hijos en la ciudad de Chepén, capital de la provincia del mismo nombre, perteneciente a la región La Libertad, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde muy joven a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi, el inició su negocio alquilando vehículos y luego pudo comprar su propia unidad, actualmente se vale de ella para brindar su servicio en la ciudad de Chepén. Adicionalmente se vale de esta unidad para comercializar forraje todas las mañanas en una de las principales avenidas de la ciudad. Estos ingresos son los unicos con los que cuenta para sostener a su familia, por ello trata de dar lo mejor de si para poder mantener estos negocios.

El contínuo uso brindado a su unidad movil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Carlos es un padre bastante responsable y entregado a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 28 year old husband and father who lives with his spouse and three children. He lives in the city of Chepén, capital of the province of the same name, part of the La Libertad region, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region. From the time he was very young, he has offered a passenger and cargo transport service in a motorcycle taxi. He began his business by renting vehicles and later was able to buy his own unit. Presently, he uses it to offer his service in the city of Chepén. In addition, he uses the unit to sell forrage every morning on one of the main avenues of the city. These sources of income are the only support his family has. Because of this, he tries to do his best to maintain these businesses. The continuous use of his mobile unit to offer the service has caused it to undergo some mechanical failures which require urgent repair so it will work properly. This is why, for the first time, it has become necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 800 nuevos soles that he plans on investing in the repair and maintanence of his vehicle. Carlos is a father who is very responsible and dedicated to his family. His greatest wish is to keep growing his business to be able to offer hs family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenence expenses for a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana, de 21 años, es una joven muy alegre y con muchas ganas de sobre salir en la vida. Vive con su esposo en la casa de su madre y lo que más desea es tener un futuro mejor.

Desde muy joven sintió que tenía que trabajar en todo lo que pudiera, fue así que a la edad de 17 años se dedicó a vender comida rápida. Con esas ganancias pudo juntar el dinero que necesitaba para comprar 2 vacas, las cuales junto a los corderos que su madre le regaló, han logrado que poco a poco salga adelante con la venta de ganado.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es alimentar a sus animales, ya que les tiene mucho cariño, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar su ganado hasta la feria de la ciudad. Con el tiempo, espera incrementar la cantidad de animales que tiene, ya que siente que es hora de crecer.

Este es el quinto préstamo de Maximiliana con MFP y quiere pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a posteriores préstamos, con lo cuales pueda mejorar su negocio, sabe que en su banco comunal la apoyaran y la guiaran, ya que es una socia muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará un par de corderos para alimentarlos y cuidarlos, y posteriormente venderlos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 21 years old. She is a very joyful young woman who really wants to get ahead in life. She lives with her husband in her mother's house and what she wants the most is to have a better future. Since the time she was very young, she felt that she had to work as much as she could. That is why, when she was 17 years old, she began to sell fast food. With those earnings she was able to get the money together that she needed to buy 2 cows. Together with the lambs that her mother gave her, she has been able to get ahead little by little by selling cattle. What she likes the most about her job is feeding her animals, since she has a lot of affection for them. She has been doing this for 7 years and thinks that the hardest part is transporting her cattle to the city market. With time, she hopes to increase the number of animals that she has, since she thinks that it is time to grow. This is the fifth loan that Maximiliana has had with MFP. She want to make her payments on time since she wants to access loans afterwards in order to improve her business. She knows that her communal bank will support her and guide her, since she is a well liked member. With the thousand nuevos soles she has requested, she will buy a couple of lambs to feed and take care of and later sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase animals

loans.name: Akwata Empola Gambwa Group 1, Mityana

texts.en:
B. Silvester is the leader of his lending in Mityana. He is a hardworking and very devoted man with a business buying produce like beans, maize, tea and coffee from the farmers in Mityana villages and selling to the retailers and shop owners as well as other customers in Mubende, Mityana and Kampala.

Over his years in business, Silvester has developed a strong bond with his suppliers in a way that they always keep produce for him even when it is scarce. He is able to make 80,000/= as weekly profits.

Silvester is grateful that his loans have always enabled him to have enough stock, hence being able to pay his children’s school fees and expand his businesses. He needs a loan to be able to buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: To buy more beans, maize, coffee and so on for increased stock

loans.name: Blanca Marisol

texts.es: La Señora Blanca Marisol O. Y., quien reside en Sector la Cuchilla, Aldea Nahualate Uno, San 	Antonio, Suchitepéquez, quien es de estado civil soltera, que tiene una familia que se integra de dos hijos, esta persona es una de las que han podido superar a través de los créditos otorgados por diferentes Asociaciones, ya que anteriormente vivía en condiciones económicas muy bajas debido a que   el negocio con el que contaba  era la venta de productos de belleza y no le generaba los ingresos necesarios que necesitaba para cubrir los gastos en el hogar, ya que su inversión en estos productos de belleza era muy poco debido a que no contaba con suficiente capital para hacer una inversión más grande que le pudiera generar un mayor ingreso. Por lo que a través del crédito a  otorgar por la Asociación ASDIR podrá comprar más productos y así variar su mercadería. Esto ha llamara la atención del cliente, s ya que sus ventas  mejoraran, gracias al apoyo a brindar de parte de la Asociación mejorará sus ingreso y sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca Marisol O. Y. lives in the Cuchilla sector, Nahualate Uno village, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez. She is single and has two children. She is a person who has managed to succeed thanks to loans from various asociations because she used to live in very low economic conditions because her cosmetics sales were insufficient to cover all household expenses. This was due to the fact that her investment in stock was small so her income was equally small. Through financing from Asociación ASDIR she will be able to buy more product thus varying her stock. This will attract more customers and her sales will improve. Thanks to support from the Association, her income and living conditions will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es:
Nerida, de 29 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado muy duro por tener una mejor vida. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Blas de 40 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Los arduos trabajos que realiza junto a su esposo en la chacra, han logrado que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que en los días de venta sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingresos es la venta de papas, ya que es tan buena su calidad que la vende en Lima a los restaurantes de la capital.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que su trabajo está dando sus frutos, lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. Con el tiempo, desea adquirir nuevas tierras para ampliar sus cultivos.

Con este, son cuatro los préstamos que Nerida tiene con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas con su banco comunal, donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a sus compañeras muy felices.

Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de papa y alverja para sembrar en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Nerida is 29 years old. She is a woman who has always worked very hard to have a better life. She lives in her own home with her husband Blas, 40 years old, and her beloved three children, who are the reason for all her hard work. The arduous work she does with her husband in the field has resulted in her crops being very well tended, and in her products being bought quickly on sale days. Her main source of income is selling potatoes, since these are of such high quality that she sells them in the restaurants of the capital city of Lima. What she likes the most about her job is harvesting her land, since she feels like her work is having rsults. She has been doing this for 9 years and the hardest thing is protecting her crops from the diseased that can affect them. In time, she wants to adquire new land to expand her crops. This will be the fourth loan that Nerida has had with MFP. She has been very punctual with her payments and she has never had any problems with her communal bank. There she is in charge of bringing the joyfulness that keeps the other members very happy. With the three thousand nuevos soles she has asked for, she will purchase potato and pea seed to plant this season.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seed

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Este cliente es un productor de la zona de Chinandega es un hombre casado y padre de 4 hijos 
El crédito lo esta solicitando para la compra de semillas e insumos para la siembra de 3 mz de sandillas 
Siempre a vivido de esta actividad y a mantenido a su familia
texts.en:
This gentleman is a farmer in the Chinandega zone. He is married and the father of four children. He is requesting this loan in order to buy seeds and supplies to plant watermelon. This is how he makes a living and supports his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Faming supples

loans.name: 1.	Julio Cesar

texts.es: A través de los créditos que CEPRODEL  me ha otorgado compre mi casa , luego vendi esta primera y compre otra , y me quedo para comprar un carro para ayudarme mas con mis ingresos, me siento muy agradecido con los créditos que me han otorgado también me facilitaron uno para mejorar parte de mi casa como comprar cin , perlines , cemento , bloque y ,mano de obra .
texts.en:
By means of loans with CEPRODEL, I was able to buy my own house. Later, I sold this first one and bought another. I still need to buy a car to help me improve my income. I feel very grateful for the loans that I have received. In addition, one loan helped me improve a part of my house, by buying zinc, rafters, cement, blocks, and paying for labor.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MAKING HOME IMPROVEMENTS

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
Nicanor, de 55 años, es un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Marina de 50 años, quien le apoya en la chacra, y con 3 de sus 8 hijos, a los cuales desea brindar una buena educación para que tengan un buen futuro al igual que sus hermanos mayores.

Sus tierras son de las mejores cultivadas en el poblado de “Yanama”, tiene sembrado papa, alverja, maíz y choclo, productos que son rápidamente comprados por los comerciantes mayoristas en el mercado de la ciudad, ya que saben de la buena calidad de sus cultivos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad, motivo por el cual es considerado uno de los mejores agricultores de su pueblo. Por otro lado, cree que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos. Con el tiempo, espera comprarse un carro con el cual pueda transportar el mismo sus productos.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Nicanor con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Él es uno de los miembros más activos de su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará abono y fertilizantes para volver más productivas sus tierras.
texts.en:
Nicanor is 55 years old. He is a very responsible and hard working father and husband. He lives in his own home with his wife, Marina, who is 50 years old. She supports him in the field. He also lives with 3 of his 8 children, to whom he wishes to offer a good education so that they can have a good future like their older siblings. His land is among the best cultivated in the town of “Yanama”. He has planted potatos, peas, and corn. These products are quickly bought by wholesalers in the city market, since they know the high quallity of his crops. What he likes the most about his work is planting his land. He does this with a lot of affection. He has been doing this for 40 years, and he is considered one of the best farmers in his town. On the other hand, he thinks that the hardest thing is protecting his crops from the diseases that can affect them. With time, he hopes to buy himself a car with which he can transport his products himself. This is the sixth loan that Nicanor has had with MFP and he feels able to make all of his payments on time. He is one of the most active members in his communal bank, and because of this he is very well liked and respected. With the thousand nuevos soles he has asked for he will buy fertilizers to make his lands more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Silvia Carolina

texts.es: 1.	La señora Silvia es una persona con dos hijos a su cargo los cuales dependen de ella , labora como conserge en la UNICA  , este préstamo lo utilizara para gastos  en  el mejoramiento de la vivienda
texts.en:
Silvia is the mother of two children who depend on her. She works as a counsoler at the UNICA. She will use the money from this loan to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy tiene 26 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus suegros a su esposa Lourdes de 27 años y lo que más desea es brindarle una mejor vida a su hija Kety de 5 años.

Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, trabaja en su chacra, sabe que tiene que poner todo su esfuerzo en hacer más fértil sus tierras para obtener una buena cosecha. Todos sus productos los vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde tiene muchos compradores debido a la buena calidad de sus cultivos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que siempre corre el peligro de que los químicos le causen alguna enfermedad. Con el tiempo, desea alquilar nuevas tierras para aumentar su producción.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Percy con MFP, en sus primeros pagos fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también, es de los pocos varones de su banco comunal, por lo cual es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus chacras estén muy productivas para la temporada de siembra que se acerca.
texts.en:
Percy is 26 years old. He is a very happy and hard-working family man. He lives in the house his in-laws left his 27 year old wife, Lourdes. What he wants most of all is to give his 5 year old daughter, Kety, a better life. He starts working his farm very early every morning. He knows that he has to put forth all of his effort to make his land more fertile in order to get a better harvest. He sells all of his products in the wholesale market in the city. He has a lot of buyers due to the good quality of his crops. What he likes best about his work is planting his land. He does it with a lot of patience. He has been doing this for 16 years. The most difficult part is fumigating his land. He always runs the risk that the chemicals will cause some time of disease. In time, he wants to rent new land to increase his production. This is Percy’s fourth loan with MFP. He was very punctual with his previous payments, and he expects to be able to do the same now. He is one of a few men in his communal bank. Therefore, he is held in high regard by the rest of his colleagues. He will use the requested 3,000 PEN to buy more natural and chemical fertilizers for his land. He wants his fields to be very productive in the planting season that is coming.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Kanizan's Group

texts.en: Kanizan is a citizen of a mid-size city named Vehari in Pakistan. She is a very caring lady who manages domestic chores and takes care of her family very efficiently. Her husband's name is S. M., and he has an animal selling business. He sells animals to butcher shops. He has 15 years of experience in this business. He has become an expert by having knowledge of every breed of animal, but he sells specifically sheep and goats because of his customers' demand for these two animals. Currently, Kanizan is applying for a loan to buy sheep and goats to expand her husbands’ animal selling business.

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats to sell

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: El Señor Domingo T. T., quien reside en Sector San Vicente, Aldea Barrios Uno, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez, quien es de estado civil soltero, que tiene una familia que se integra de un hijo, esta persona ha sido de aquellas que han podido salir adelante a través sus esfuerzos diario ya que anteriormente vivía en condiciones económicas muy bajas debido a que el negocio con el que contaba el cual era la compra y venta de madera, no le generaba los ingresos necesario que necesitaba para cubrir los gastos en el hogar, ya que la compra que el hacia era muy poca debido a que no contaba con suficiente capital para hacer una compra más grande que le pudiera generar un mayor ingreso. Por lo que se vio en la necesidad de acudir a la asociación Asdir a solicitud de un préstamo para la compra demás productos que lo comercializara en diferentes puntos de San Antonio y en la ciudad capital. Esto le generara más clientes porque la inversión estará en constante rotación  ya que actualmente sus ventas han  mejorado, gracias a los esfuerzo  y a la buena administración que realiza con su capital. Con los ingresos que obtiene puede ofrecerles una mejor forma de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Domingo T. T. lives in the San Vicente sector, Barrios Uno village, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez. He is single and has a son. He has succeeded thanks to his daily efforts because he used to live in very poor economic conditions. He is a lumber merchant but he wasn’t producing sufficient income to meet all household expenses because he lacked funds to buy large amounts of lumber that would generate higher profits. For this reason, he called upon Asociación Asdir to request funds to buy more product so that he can sell it in various parts of San Antonio and in the capital. This will generate more customers because his stock will be constantl rotating. His sales have improved, thanks to his effort and good management of his capital. His income will permit him to provide a better standard of living for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Tomas Manuel

texts.es:
Este cliente es agricultor de la zona de potosí es una zona alejada de la ciudad por lo que la electricidad no llega hasta esa área 
 Por tal razón esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de un equipo solar y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida es un hombre soltero padre de dos hijos
texts.en:
This client is a farmer in the zone of Potosi, which is far from the city and therefore, electricity does not reach the area. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase solar panels to improve his quality of life. He is a single man and the father of two children.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase solar panels

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: JORGE LUIS S. LABORA COMO JARDINERO EN LA UNICA TIEN DOS HIJOS MENORES LOS CUALES DEPENDE DE EL Y SU COMPAÑERA DE VIDA EL ESTA SOLICITANDO UN PRESTAMO POR PRIMERA VEZ PARA ASUNTOS DE SAÑLUD COMPRAR MEDICINA PARA UN FAMILIAR SUYO..
texts.en:
Jorge Luis S. works as a gardener in La Unica. He has two young children who depend on him and his life partner. He is requesting a loan for the first time in order to buy medicine for a relative of his.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For his mother's medical expenses and medicine

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en: Kosar, wife of M. S., lives in a mid-size city named Vehari in Pakistan. She is an active lady. She stays at home and does household work and helps her husband by taking care of his animals. Basically, her husband, whose name is M. S., is involved in an animal selling business. He raises goats and sells them to butcher shops and earns profit. Presently, they have three goats that they take care of. Kosar is applying for a loan to buy more goats to expand her husband's animal selling business.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Es el tercer crédito que trabaja con CEPRODEL  lo cuales le han servido para mejora su condición de vida anteriormente su casa no contaba con material de concreto adecuado para su seguridad, tenia puertas en mal estado y con estos financiamientos ha logrado asegurar su vivienda para
texts.en:
This is Maria's third loan with CEPRODEL, all of which have been used to improve her quality of life. Previously, her house did not have an adequate amount of concrete for safety, and the doors were in poor condition. With these loans she has managed to make her home much more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvements

loans.name: Bakht's Group

texts.en:
Bakht M. A. A. is from the mid-size city,Vehari, in Pakistan.  She operates a tailoring business. She sews clothes and returns them on time. Bakht is passionate about her work. Her nature is one of the reasons that customers seek her out. Bakht does this work to share the financial burden with her husband.
Her husband, M. A. A., sells pesticides and fertilizer to  farmers. He has been in this business for over 10 years. They are seeking capital to buy more pesticides and fertilizer to sell.

loans.use: To buy pesticides & fetilizer to sell

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is the wife of M. A. who has been involved in an animal sales business for the over 20 years. His good knowledge about animal breeds attracts customers.
Razia is a very caring lady. She does the domestic chores but she helps her husband by taking care of his animals too. Presently they have one cow at their home. Razia is requesting  a loan to buy goats to meet the needs of M.'s customers.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Wendy Guissel

texts.es: LA SEÑORA WENDY GUISSEL P. ES CASADA MADRE DE UN NIÑO DE 5 AÑOS EL CUAL ASISTE A LA ESCUELA , LA SEÑORA LABORA COMO GERENTE DE AGENCIAS EN SAN RAFAEL DE L SUR.DURANTE EL TIEMPO QUE HA LABORADO CON CEPRODEL HA SABIDO APROVECHAR LA OPORTUNIDA YA QUE LE HAN SERVIDO PARA MEJORAR SU CSA Y MEJORA SU NIVE DE VIADA.
texts.en:
Mrs. Wendy is a married mother with a 5-year-old boy who attends school. Wendy works as manager of agencies in San Rafael del Sur. During the time she has worked with CEPRODEL, she has known how to take advantage of the opportunity. She has used her loans to improve her house as well as her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PAYING MEDICAL EXPENSES

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: El señor José Manuel T. es padre de dos hijas a las que mantiene y proporciona las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. El caballero José Manuel ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo el mejoramiento de su vivienda con el fin de proporcionarle a sus pequeñas hijas las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen y tengan un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
José Manuel T. is married and has two children. He works as an aid to general services in Ceprodel. He has received five loans, which have helped his family’s well-being. He has used them to make improvements to his house. “I am grateful for the support that Ceprodel has given me during these five years.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Shama's Group

texts.en: Shama B. A. is from the mid-size city,Vehari,in Pakistan. She is a vigorous lady. After finishing the household chores she sews clothes for her neighbors. Her work gives her money which helps her to share the financial burden with her husband who is involved in a dairy business. He purchases milk from the milk shops and sells to the community. His work requires struggle but it doesn’t give him good return because he has to pay a fee for purchasing the milk. Shama is requesting  a loan to purchase a dairy cow so that her husband can start selling his own milk and can generate more profit.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es: Pablo Emilio Gómez labora como vigilante de CEPRODEL  desde hace 11 años casado , tiene 3 hijos quiene dependen de el y su esposa , el señor pablo Emilio ha obtenido 9 créditos con CEPRODEL  estos han sido de mucha utilidad en el desarrollo de su famila , ya que su casita la ha hecha  atreves  de los financiamientos que le han otorgado en CEPRODEL por lo que agradece el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Pablo Emilio Gómez has worked as a guard for Ceprodel for 11 years. He is married, and he and his wife have three children who are dependent upon them. Pablo Emilio has had nine loans with Ceprodel. They have been very useful to his family’s well-being. He built his house via the loans from Ceprodel. He is grateful for the help he received.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make improvements on his house

loans.name: Butogota Group A, Kihihi

texts.en:
N. Norah, the person that is raising her hand in the photo, is the leader of her lending group in Butogota, Kihihi. She is 68 years old and a good leader and very hardworking.

Norah has a business selling bunches of matooke (green plantain) from her area of Butogota market. Her other form of income is through farming and, in total, she is able to make 50,000/= as weekly profits.

Nora has nine children and her goal is to ensure that she takes good care of her family. For the sixteen years she has been in business, she has been able to acquire land as well as improve her family’s welfare.

Before Nora’s current business, she used to make handcrafts but, since they were not so profitable, she transferred to this business. Nora needs a loan to be able to buy more matooke to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of matooke to sell

loans.name: Anwar's Group

texts.en:
Anwar L. A.  is a very talented lady. She makes artificial jewelry sets and goes to the jewelry shops to sell them. She has given birth to four daughters. Her elder daughter helps her in her business and the others are enrolled in school and are getting an education. 
Anwar's husband, L. A., is involved in a dairy business. Presently, he has one buffalo and from her he gets milk which he sells to the milk shops. Anwar is requesting a loan to purchase another buffalo for the expansion of her husband’s dairy business.

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo for the dairy business

loans.name: Federico Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor FEDERICO ANTONIO V. M., Labora como  vigilante  en el mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua y padre de familia de dos niños a los que tiene en el colegio, el junto con su esposa han sacado a delante la familia.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación del techo  de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor FEDERICO ANTONIO V. M. works as a guard in Managua’s Iván Montenegro Market. He is the father of two children who are in high school, and he and his wife have worked to make the family move forward.

The loan applied for is to invest in the purchase of construction materials for improving the roof of the house in which he lives, with the goal of offering his children greater security and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving and enlarging his dwelling.

loans.name: Nelson Ramiro

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	El Sr. Nelson G. M. es un Agricultor con 15 años de experiencia y vive en la comarca de Palo Alto municipio del Viejo.

El va a utilizar el crédito para comprar dos vacas paridas ya que ellas son las que le proporcionan el alimento diario porque vende de 15 a 20lts  de    leche diario.

Este es el tercer crédito que tiene con la Institución  y hasta la fecha todos los créditos los ha pagado muy bien y espera seguir trabajando con la Institución.
texts.en:
Nelson G. M. has 15 years of experience working in agriculture. He lives in the Palo Alto region in the municipality of Viejo. He will use this loan to buy 2 dairy cows because these will provide 15-20 liters of milk daily that he will sell. This is the 3rd loan that he has taken with the Institution and up to this date he has paid off his loans very well; he hopes to continue to work with the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 2 dairy cows

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora O. Trabaja en Hospital Escuela Oscar Danilo Rosales – León., realiza turnos quebrados por semana desempeñándose como enfermera el resto del tiempo es dedicada a su familia.

El crédito que ha solicitado es para realizar mejora habitacional específicamente el techo que se encuentra en mal estado por lo cual quiere prepararse para la época de lluvia.

 Cabe mencionar que este es el sexto crédito con nuestra institución, los anteriores han sido destinados para mejoras de vivienda ya que fue de gran ayuda para tener mejores condiciones en su hogar para su familia.
texts.en:
Señora O. works in the Hospital Escuela Oscar Danilo Rosales (Oscar Danilo Rosales Teaching Hospital) in León. She works irregular shifts as a nurse throughout the week. The rest of the time she cares for her family.

The loan she has applied for is to make improvements to her house, specifically the roof, which is in a bad state. She wants to be prepared for the rainy season.

She mentioned that this is her sixth loan with our institution. The prior loans have been used to improve her dwelling and have been a great help in bringing better living conditions to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc, sand, piedrin (a type of building stone), nails, and cement and payment for laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more motorcycle spare parts for his business

loans.name: Henry Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor HENRY ANTONIO A. M., Labora como Ayudante de servicios Generales en Centro de Formación Profesional Nicaragüense Holandés, es casado y padre de  cinco Hijos y tres están en el colegio el junto con su esposo han podido sacar a delate la familia.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación  de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Henry Antonio A. M. is a General Services Assistant at the Dutch-Nicaraguan Center for Professional Training. He is married and the father of five children, three of whom are in high school. Together with his wife, he has been able to help his family get ahead. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of building materials to remodel his home to make it more secure. He will thereby provide his children with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements and addition to home

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina tiene 37 años, es una madre de familia muy laboriosa y responsable, vive en la casa de sus suegros junto a su esposo, Tito de 38 años, y sus 2 hijos.

Son 16 horas las que pasa dentro de su tienda, ya que abre a las 6 de la mañana y atiende todo el día, de corrido, hasta aproximadamente las 10 de la noche. Su bodega está ubicada frente de un colegio secundario de su comunidad y es muy concurrida por los alumnos de ese plantel, como también por los profesores, a quienes además brinda el servicio de pensión (alimentos diarios). 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en la comunidad, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el quinto préstamo de Albina con MFP, está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es muy respetada por la puntualidad que demuestra en sus pagos. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor el stock de su tienda.
texts.en:
Albina is 37 years old and is a very hardworking and responsible mother. She lives in her mother and father-in law’s house together with her husband, Tito, who is 38 years old, and their 2 children.

She spends 16 hours inside her store since it opens at 6am and she keeps it open all day, without a break, until approximately 10pm. Her grocery store is located in front of a high school in her community and is very popular among the students there, as well as the teachers, to whom she also provides food (daily meals).

What she likes most about her job is talking with her customers and finding out about the things that happen in the community. She has been in this business for 3 years and considers the most difficult part to be having to stay in her store all day, without being able to go out to the street. With time, she hopes that her business will grow and can provide her with better earnings.

This is Albina’s fifth loan with MFP and she is ready to work very hard to make her payments on time. She is very respected in her communal bank for the punctuality that she shows in her payments. With the 1,000 PEN requested, she will purchase more products to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, de 30 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Yony de 35 años y su hijo Edison de 10 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Su tienda de abarrotes es una de las más concurridas del poblado de “Villa Visca”. El carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera en abrir.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su pueblo. Lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer gran parte del día en su tienda, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para cultivar sus tierras. Para más adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda para tener más productos que vender en stock.

Este el tercer préstamo de Gladys con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes y así incrementará su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 30 years old and is a very loving and happy mother. She lives in her own house together with her husband, Yony, who is 35 years old, and their 10-year-old son, Edison, both of whom are the motivation for her efforts.

Her grocery store is one of the most popular in the Villa Vesca area. Her charisma and friendliness have made her preferable among her neighbors, who do not doubt shopping very early since they know that she is the first store to open.

What she likes most about her work is talking with her neighbors about the things that happen in the town. She has been in this business for 2 years and considers the most difficult part to be having to stay in her store the majority of the day, as it doesn’t leave her much time to cultivate her lands. In the future, she hopes to expand her store to have more products in stock to sell.

This is Gladys’ third loan with MFP. She knows that if she makes her loan payments on time, she will be able to access another loan more easily and without making complications for her communal bank, where she is very well-liked by the rest of her partners. With the 2,000 PEN requested, she will purchase more goods for her grocery store and increase her stock of products.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 27 años y es una madre de familia muy trabajadora. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Teófilo de 31 años y sus 2 hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro.

Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas; cultiva papas y maíz, las cuales lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta la ciudad, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, desea alquilar un puesto estable en el mercado mayorista, ya que por ahora vende como ambulante.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Hilda con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar y proteger sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Hilda is 27 years old and is a very hardworking mother. She lives in a rented house together with her husband, Teófilo, who is 31, and their 2 children, to whom she wants to provide a better future.

With much effort, she has been able to work on her lands and make them productive again. She grows corn and potatoes, which she brings to sell at the city’s wholesale market, where she sells them wholesale. Her crops have given her the necessary income to support her family. This is why she wants to put all of her efforts into having her business succeed.

What she likes most about her work is caring for her crops. She has worked in this business for 8 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to the city, since the bags that she brings are very heavy and are tiring. In the future, she wants to rent a stand at the wholesale market since she currently sells on foot.

This is Hilda’s seventh loan with MFP and she has been very punctual with her previous loans and hopes to be so again with this one. She is a very active member of her communal bank and is always on top of the agreements reached by her group. With the 2,500 PEN requested, she will purchase more fertilizer and insecticide, with which she hopes to improve and protect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo M. labora en una universidad de Managua con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a su amada familia compuesta por su esposa y sus hijos.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación  de la vivienda en la que habita ya que necesita la pronta inversión para reconstruirla y lo estará llevando a cabo con el objetivo de brindarle a su familia mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor LEONARDO M. O. works as a security guard in the Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua (Autonomous National University of Nicaragua). He is married and the father of 4 children who are in high school. He and his wife have been able to make the the family progress. The loan applied for is to invest in the purchase of construction materials for remodeling their home, with the goal of offering his children greater security and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving and enlarging his home.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora A., se traslada desde su comarca Monte Redondo donde vive hasta el  M. de la terminal tercera calle desde las 5:00am, con el objetivo de ofertar a su clientela la variedad de productos lácteos, finalizando su venta a las 2:00pm que es la hora que ingresa el ultimo vehículo en su comarca donde vive.
Este crédito que solicito es  para  incrementar su capital de trabajo y de esta manera ofertar producto de mejor calidad, además quiere aprovechar la temporada de semana santa que es la época donde se consume más el producto.
texts.en:
Starting at 5:00 a.m.,Mrs. A. travels from the Monte Redondo area where she lives to the market at the Third Street terminal, with the aim of offering her customers a variety of dairy products. She ends her sales at 2:00 p.m., when the last vehicle goes to the district where she lives. The loan she is requesting is to increase her working capital, so that she can offer higher-quality products. In addition, she would like to take advantage of the Easter season, which is a time when more of these products are consumed.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hard cheese, farmer's cheese and clotted cream

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 61 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha querido brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Clímaco de 68 años y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.

Su trabajo es el cultivo de maíz y papas, esta labor la realiza junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para obtener ingresos para su familia. Isabel ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden amenazar su productividad, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos y con su venta pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Isabel con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono para sus cultivos y contratará operarios para que trabajen sus tierras.
texts.en:
Isabel is 61 years old and is a woman who, throughout her life, has always wanted to provide the best to her children. She lives in her own house together with her 68-year-old husband, Clímaco, and what she wants most is to have a calm retirement.

She works cultivating corn and potatoes, which she does together with her husband, who also works hard to obtain income for the family. Isabel has seen it to be convenient to bring her products to the city’s wholesale market, where according to evidence is where she has the best earnings.

What she likes most about her work is caring for her crops against diseases that can threaten their productivity. She has been in this business for 20 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products, since the road is very long and tiring. With time, she hopes to purchase new lands to increase her cultivation and with their sale, she can improve her income.

This is Isabel’s first loan with MFP. She feels an obligation to make her payments on time, as she does not want to cause any problems for the members of her communal bank, where she is very well-liked. With the 1,000 PEN requested, she will purchase more fertilizer for her crops and will hire machine workers to work on her lands.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hire workers

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 58 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos menores hijas y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

El trabajo al que se dedica es el cultivo de papas, maíz y alverjas. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en sus chacras, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Ella vende sus cultivos en el mercado de la ciudad, puesto que es donde mejor le pagan.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Lleva 28 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre hay el peligro de que los químicos la enfermen. Para más adelante, sembrará en todas sus tierras para incrementar su producción.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Lucia con MFP, manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más insecticidas, ya que desea tener sus terrenos libres de plagas.
texts.en:
Lucia is 58 years old and is a very happy and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house together with her two younger daughters and what she wants most is to improve their quality of life.

Her business is cultivating potatoes, corn, and peas. Every day early in the morning, she works on her farms, since she knows that the money that she earns from her crop sales will depend greatly on the quality of her products. She sells her crops in the city market, where they pay her the best. What she likes most about her work is harvesting her lands, as she feels that then her months of work pay off. She has been in this business for 28 years and considers the most difficult part to be spraying her lands, as there is always the danger that the chemicals can make her sick. In the future, she will plant more on her lands to increase her production.

This is Lucia’s ninth loan with MFP and the loan money will help her greatly to progress in her work. She is very well-liked by her fellow communal members, as she is very supportive with them. With the 3,000 PEN requested, she will purchase more insecticides, as she wants her lands to be pest-free.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El Señor SANTIAGO S. R., Labora como  vigilante  en el mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua y padre de familia de tres niños a los que tiene en el colegio, el junto con su esposa han sacado a delante la familia.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como pintura y 2 hojas de zinc, para la remodelación  de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Santiago S. R. works as a guard in the Iván Montenegro of Managua market. He is the father of three children who are in school, and together with his wife, they have given the children a better future. The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of construction materials such as paint, and 2 sheets of zinc. These materials are for the remodeling of their home, with the goal of giving the children safer and better living conditions

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and enlarge his home

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
