María tiene 51 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus dos menores hijas, a quienes desea dar una mejor vida.

Los hermosos campos del poblado de Villa Visca han sido para María el lugar que la vio crecer y formar su familia. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra y ahora tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivas sus alverjas, papas y choclos, lleva 26 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el lugar donde los vende en el mercado de la ciudad. Con el tiempo, espera tener un pequeño puesto en el mercado, ya que siente que pierde mucho al vender sus productos al por mayor.

Este es el quinto préstamo de María con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Dentro su banco comunal siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, ya que este producto se está vendiendo muy bien en el mercado.
texts.en:
Maria, 51, is a hardworking and unassuming woman. She lives in her own home with her 2 youngest daughters, for whom she wants to provide a better life. The beautiful countryside of the Villa Visca village has been, for Maria, a good place to start a family and see it grow. From the time she was very small her parents taught her to work on the farm, and now she has her own lands on which she works with a lot of care and sacrifice. What she likes most about her work is to cultivate peas, potatoes and corn. She has been doing this for 26 years, and what she considers most difficult is to transport her products to the place where they are sold in the market in the city. With time, she hopes to have a small stall in the market, since she feels that she loses out a lot by selling her products at wholesale. This is the 5th loan that Maria has taken from MFP. She knows that she has the responsibility to make all of her payments on time, and she is ready to do this. Within her communal bank she is always aware of all of the agreements that they have reached as a group. With the 2,000 Peruvian soles requested she will buy pea seeds, since this product is selling very well in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pea seeds

loans.name: Haleema's Group

texts.en:
Haleema M. S. is from the city of  Vehari in Pakistan. She has a two room house in which she has been living with her family for the last 20 years. She is an uneducated lady but she has very good talking skills.  She owns and operates her clothes selling business. She purchases clothes from different cites (Lahore & Faisalabad) because of their cheap rates and great quality items. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She sells the clothes in her community and earns good profit on it. 
Her husband name is M. S.. He is a milk seller. He gets milk from his cow and sells to the milk shops and in the community. Presently they have one cow but now they want to expand their dairy business. For this reason Haleema is requesting of a loan to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy another cow for a dairy business

loans.name: Edgar Jose

texts.es:
El Señor EDGAR JOSE F. R., Labora como Metrologo en el mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua, es casado y padre de  un Hijo y este se
 Encuentra en el colegio el junto con su esposo han podido sacar a delate la familia.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación  de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edgar José F. R. works as an Inspector at the Iván Montenegro Market in Managua. He is married and the father of one high-school aged son. Together with his wife, he has been able to help his family get ahead. He will invest this loan in the purchase of building materials to remodel his home, making it more secure. He will thereby provide better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements and addition to home

loans.name: Aura Magali

texts.es:
La señora Aura Q.  a la actividad que se dedica es la venta  ropa  en el mercado el central  de león dando inicio a sus ventas  a las 8:00 Am donde recibe a su clientela para ofertar su mercadería.
 
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de ropa  como chores, camisas, camisetas, calcetas, calcetines, brasieles, blúmeres, calzones, bikines, trajes de niños,etc.   

Se puede decir que la sra Q. es madre soltera y ha sacado adelante tanto su tramo de trabajo como a sus hijos   con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Aura Q. sells clothing in León's central market. She offers her merchandise to customers daily starting at 8:00 am. She will use this loan to purchase clothing, including shorts, shirts, t-shirts, tank tops, underwear, socks, bras, bathing suits, and children's clothes. It should be noted that Ms. Q. is a single mother who has not only gotten ahead in business but has also helped her children get ahead in school.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, including shorts, shirts, t-shirts, tank tops, underwear, socks, bras, bathing suits, and children's clothes

loans.name: Oralia Mercedes

texts.es:
El Señor ORALIA MERCEDES G. L., Labora como Responsable de Computo en el mercado Roberto Huembés de Managua, es casada y madres de dos niños a los que tiene en el colegio ella junto con su esposo han podido sacar a delate la familia.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación  de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Oralia Mercédes González López is the Technology Manager at Managua's Roberto Huembés Market. She is married and the mother of two high school aged children. Together with her husband, she has helped her family get ahead. She will invest this loan in building materials to remodel her home to make it more secure and thereby provide better living conditions for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for Holy Week

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El Señor WALTER A. G., Labora como oficial de mantenimiento en el mercado de Mayoreo de Managua, es casado y padre de  tres Hijos a los que tiene en el colegio ella junto con su esposo han podido sacar a delate la familia.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación  de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Walter A. G. works as a maintenance official in the Mayoreo market in Managua. He is married and has three children. The children are in school. He and his wife have been able to get their family ahead. The requested loan is to buy construction materials to remodel his home. His goal is to give his family greater security and to give his children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enlarge and improve his house

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is the  wife of S. A..  They both are citizens of the mid-size city of Vehari, in Pakistan. They own a three room house in which they have been living with their four children: three sons and one daughter for the past 20 years. All of their children are getting an education from the  local school. Nusrat is a very caring lady. She stays at home and takes care of her family and does domestic chores. 
Her husband belongs to an agriculture profession. He supplies the pesticides and fertilizer to the farmers and earns profit from it. He has been in this profession for the past 15 years. His earnings are the main income for their family. Nusrat is requesting for a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizer in bulk to increase her husband's business profit.

loans.use: To buy pesticides & fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Butogota Group D, Kihihi

texts.en:
B. Sulaiman is 39 years old and married with three children. He is the one raising his hand in the group photo.

Sulaiman is a butcher from Butogota central and has been eight years in his business which he inherited from his father. He is able to make 900,000/= as weekly profits yet his other sources of income include farming and bricklaying. He employs men to help with these other businesses.

Sulaiman needs a loan to be able to buy more cows for slaughter. Before this business transformation, Sulaiman was a farmer and a carpenter and he does not regret the move he made. He is such a well behaved man, very disciplined and hardworking, who has also seen his business grow.

loans.use: To buy more cows for slaughter in his butcher shop

loans.name: Mauricio De Jesus

texts.es:
El Señor MAURICIO DE JESUS M. Z., Labora como oficial de mantenimiento en el mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua, es casado y padre de  tres Hijos a los que tiene en el colegio ella junto con su esposo han podido sacar a delate la familia.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación  de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mauricio de Jesús M. Z. works as a maintenance official in the Iván Montenegro market in Managua. He is married and has three children. The children are in school. He and his wife have been able to get their family ahead. The requested loan is to buy construction materials to remodel his home. His goal is to give his family greater security and to give his children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enlarge and improve his house

loans.name: Butogota Group C, Kihihi

texts.en:
R. Justus, the one that is raising his hand in the photo, is the leader of his lending group in Kihihi. He is a hardworking and well-behaved man who is married with five children.

Justus has a business selling electronics from Butogota Central and is able to make 40,000/= as weekly profits from his three-year-old business. He says that before his current business, he used to sell tea, sugarcane and coffee to make a living.

Justus’ electronics include radios, bulbs, electrical wire, and so on. He says that he has seen his business grow to its current state and he is grateful for the loans that have made it happen. He needs a new loan to be able to stock more electronics to sell.

loans.use: To buy more electronics like switches, wire and so on

loans.name: Maria Rufina

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente está ubicado en la comarca el jicarito su dirección es de la bomba de agua 100 vrs al sur.
Ella los primeros 3 créditos fueron para la crianza de cerdos y los otros posteriores fueron para ganado, los mismos le han se3rvido para la compra e terreno y mejoramiento del ganado.
texts.en:
This client is located in the Jicarito region. Her address is 100 varas (a vara is approximately .8 meter) south of the water pump. She used the first three loans for raising pigs. The later loans were for livestock. She also bought a piece of land and improved her livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retention of three dairy cows

loans.name: Butogota Group E, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Hope, shown with hand raised in the group photo, is 43 years old and married with five children.

Hope has operated a bar and lodge in Butogota Upper for five years and, this being a rural area, she is able to make 150,000/- as monthly profits. Her other sources of income include the sale of tea since she has a tea farm as well as buying from other farmers and supplying the tea factory in her area.

However, Hope needs a loan to be able to buy more bedsheets and beers together with other drinks for her business so that it can prosper. Before her current business, she was a business lady selling produce but she says that her current business gives her more freedom and leaves her with more ample time for farming as her side income.

Hope’s dream is to expand her business and develop her family.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and beers plus bedsheets for her business

loans.name: 03.01.04 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Bay L. T. (4) is a 60 year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa, Thanh Hoa.  Bay is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 03.01.04.

Bay is married and has 4 adult -aged children.  To making a living, Bay operates a family member's business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community.  Bay has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Bay joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Bay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for saL..  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.000.000 VND which also will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for saL..  The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Bay from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Bay plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Dan (121) is a 51 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

2.  N. T. Nguyet (122) is a 27 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

3.  T. T. Tuyen (123) is a 25 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

4. L. T. Binh (124) is a 35 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Bay L. T. (4) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở  Hoang Hoa, Thanh Hoa.  Bay là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03.01.04 Hoang Hoa (03.01.04 Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hải sản như cá và tôm trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Bay thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 30 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Bay kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2005, Bay đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Bay đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần T.ết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Dan (121) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  N. T. Nguyet (122) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


3.  T. T. Tuyen (123) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  L. T. Binh (124) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida B. is from the village of Usocan. She is 47 years old. Zenaida is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Zenaida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Zenaida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rommel Arturo

texts.es:
El Sr. Rommel Céspedes trabaja como asalariado en el Pali que está ubicado en el municipio del Viejo. 

El va a utilizar el crédito en la compra de algunos artículos que necesita comprar para el hogar ya que hay ciertos electrodomésticos que son de gran utilidad para la familia y el no los tiene.

Este es el segundo crédito que el Sr. Céspedes tiene con la Institución y espera seguir trabajando Ceprodel.
texts.en:
Rommel Céspedes is a salaried worker for Pali (a supermarket), which is located in the Viejo municipality. He will use the loan to buy some items he needs to purchase for his house. There are some domestic appliances that are very useful for the family, and he does not have them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy domestic appliances for his house

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda F. is from the village of Danao. She is 40 years old. Imelda is married and has 3 adult-age children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Imelda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Juliana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora V. trabaja en una escuela de manejo con el salario que devenga ahí mantiene y sufraga los gastos de su menor hijo que tiene cinco años de edad, el crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL es para gastos personales. Ella sacrificadamente le quiere dar un mejor nivel de vida a su hijo y una buena educación familiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. V. works at a driving school. She uses her salary to support her five year old son and to pay his expenses. The loan she is requesting from Ceprodel is for personal expenses. She selflessly wants to give her son a better quality of life and a good family education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia's husband works in a woodcrafts workshop where wooden crosses and statues are being produced as well as mosaic ornamentation and wooden statues for churches and tourists. 

Four years ago, she and her husband started doing the same work in their house, preparing to start their own business. They both have three children whose expenses are growing as they grow up. Therefore, they decided that it's time to start their business and rent a workshop place.

Nadia took a loan from FATEN that they needed, in addition to their savings, to pay the first month's rent and buy raw material to start working in their own workshop. She hopes to have good returns as her husband is known in the area for his unique, professional and beautiful work.

Nadia is the one in the picture above at FATEN's office.

loans.use: To rent a workshop and buy materials

loans.name: Magda Simona

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente trabaja como secretaria del colegio del Jicarito, es originaria de la misma comunidad ella habita de la iglesia católica 600 vrs al este
Además de la actividad laboral se dedica a crianza de cerdos para tener ingresos que apoye el núcleo familiar
A logrado venir preparando académicamente a su hija y también ella está estudiando para obtener un título como profesora
texts.en:
This client works as a secretary at the Jicarito School. She is from the same community. She lives 600 varas (a vara is approximately .8 meter) east of the Catholic Church. In addition to her secretarial work, she also raises pigs in order to have earnings to help her family. She has been academically preparing her daughter, and she is also studying to get a teacher’s degree.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University expenses, daughter's transportation, buy booklets

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: Cruz M. H. 59 años de edad, reside en Cantón el Amate, ubicado en San Isidro departamento de  Cabañas. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor y junto a dos nietos. Cruz posee una venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, así mismo comercializa productos para el cuidado de la piel y cosméticos, el negocio está ubicado en un pequeño centro comercial, el cual está ubicado a la entrada de San Isidro, este es un lugar muy transitado por las personas y por el transporte público, lo que beneficia a Cruz ya que se encuentra a la vista de todas las personas. De esta misma manera ella comercializa la ropa de forma ambulante por diferentes cantones del lugar, esto le asegura mayores ganancias las cuales son de mucha ayuda para el bienestar de su familia, ya que sus nietos dependen del trabajo de la señora Cruz y de su esposo. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual desea poder invertir aún más en su negocio, comprando más ropa, cosméticos y de esta misma manera surtiéndolo con otros productos como: zapatos, ropa interior y más. Uno de los mayores deseos de Cruz es poder aprovechar la temporada de Semana Santa ya que en este tiempo sus ventas aumentan, lo cual sería de gran beneficio para ella.
texts.en:
Cruz M. H., 59, lives in the canton of El Amate, located in San Isidro in the department of Cabañas. She lives with her husband, who works in agriculture, and their two grandchildren. Cruz has a business selling clothing for men, women and children. She also markets skin care products and cosmetics. Her business is located in a small commercial center which is located at the entrance of San Isidro. This is a place that many people pass through, as there is public transportation there, which benefits Cruz because her business is seen by all of these people. Cruz also works as a street vendor selling clothing in various cantons in her area. This assures her greater earnings, which is a great help to her family's economic welfare, as she and her husband are supporting their grandchildren. For this reason she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which she will use to invest in her business, buying more clothing and cosmetics, and stocking her business with other products such as shoes, underwear, and more. One of Cruz's main wishes is to be able to take advantage of the Semana Santa (Easter Season), since at this time the sales rise, and this would be a great benefit for her.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics and shoes

loans.name: Mrs. Rom Mul Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank group has nine people who live in Pun Phnum village in Takeo province. Mrs. Rom M. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Rom M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to help in supporting her family. She and her husband, Mr. Chhoeurn Moeurn, who is a motorbike taxi driver, have five children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, and the others are attending the local public school. Though this family works hard, they do not earn enough income. Thus, Mrs.Rom M. has decided to start a new business and is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Laura Esperanza

texts.es: Laura Esperanza R. L. de 50 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Miguel. Vive junto a sus dos hijos, de 17 y 12 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar en la escuela del lugar. Ella posee un comedor en el que se encarga de elaborar desayunos y almuerzos de lunes a sábado, así mismo comercializa bebidas, golosinas y otros productos más. Dicho negocio está ubicado frente a la Fiscalía General de La República regional de San Miguel, en donde Laura vende la mayor parte de sus alimentos con los empleados de la Fiscalía, contando de esta manera con muchos clientes fijos los cuales día tras día consumen sus productos. Una de las principales razones de estos es porque Laura ya posee 10 años de tener este negocio, por lo que es muy conocida en el lugar siendo recomendada por muchas personas. Laura solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima necesaria para poder elaborar mayor cantidad de comidas y de esta forma extender el menú, entre los ingredientes que ella más necesita están: granos básicos, sodas, frutas, verduras, golosinas y pan. Esto llena de mucha ilusión a Laura ya que ella es una persona muy trabajadora quien siempre está buscando la manera de salir adelante y brindarles todo lo necesario a sus dos hijos los cuales dependen por completo de ella.
texts.en:
Laura Esperanza R. L., 50, lives in San Miguel department with her two children, who are 1 7 and 12 years old and are students at the local school. She has a small eatery where she prepares breakfasts and lunches from Monday through Saturday; she also sells beverages, snacks and other products. Her place of business is located across from the offices of the San Miguel Region Attorney General’s office; most of her sales are to employees of this office, who are regular customers that consume her meals daily. One of the main reasons this is so is that Laura has been in this line of work for 10 years so she is very well-known and highly recommended by many people in the area. Laura is asking for funds to buy all the raw ingredients she needs to make a larger quantity of meals so that she can expand her menu. Among the most needed ingredients are: basic grains, soft-drinks, fruit, vegetables, snacks and bread. This fills Laura with much enthusiasm because she is a hard-working woman who is always looking for ways to get ahead in life and provide for her two children, who are completely dependent on her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, soft-drinks, fruit, vegetables, snacks and bread.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn M. is from the village of Danao. She is 29 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jenelyn owns & operates a fishing business. She harvests and sells ocean-caught fish to the local community. Jenelyn has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jenelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation, and her ability to engage in business activities. Jenelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. That loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Jenelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. For Jenelyn, this will be the 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living condition of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her fishing business

loans.name: Marta Del Rosario

texts.es: Marta del Rosario V. D. M. D. 71 años D. edad, Vive en Colonia Quezaltepeque, ubicada en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como jefe D. ventas D. una empresa privada y también vive junto a su hijo el cual se dedica a trabajar. La señora Marta posee un negocio propio en el cual se dedica a vender diferentes productos como juguetes, flotadores, trajes D. baño para niñas, almohadas y accesorios para regalos. DesD. hace muchos años atrás que ella se dedica a este negocio, gracias al cual ha logrado obtener ganancias muy aceptables. Marta solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir su negocio con todo lo esencial  para esta Semana Santa como mayor cantidad D. trajes D. baño, flotadores y bloqueadores solares, esto lo hace con el deseo D. incrementar sus ventas y así poder invertir aún más en el, ya que es gracias a este negocio como Marta pueD. obtener el dinero necesario para solventar todos sus gastos.
texts.en:
Marta del Rosario V. D. M. is 71 years old and resides in the Quezaltepeque development, located in La Libertad department. She lives with her husband, who is the sales manager for a private company. She also lives with her son, and he is the reason for her efforts at work. The business owned by la señora Marta sells toys, inflatable tubes, bathing suits for girls, pillows, and accessories for gifts. She has owned this business for many years and has received a good income from it. Marta requests a loan to supply her business with everything necessary this Holy Week, such as more bathing suits, inflatable tubes, and sun block. Thus she wishes to increase her sales, and then she will be able to invest even more in her business. Thanks to her business Marta can earn the money necessary to pay all her expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bathing suits, inner tubes, and sun block.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es una profesora que tiene 22 años de dar clases en el, colegio el jicarito vive en la comunidad del trabuco del tanque de agua 500 vrs al este.
Los créditos le han servido para preparar académicamente a sus hijos y par su misma salud, ya quec a ella la han operado 2 veces y también los mismos le han ayudado a mejorar su vivienda
texts.en:
This client is a teacher, and she has been teaching at the Jicarito School for 22 years. She lives in the Trabuco community 500 varas (a vara is approximately .8 meter) to the east of the water tank. She has used the loans to academically prepare her children and for her health. She has had two operations. Also, the loans have helped to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses and medications

loans.name: 03..01.04 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
"Lieu N. T. (301119) is a 36 year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa.  Lieu is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 03.01.04 Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa (03.01.04 Hoang Hoa ).


Lieu is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Lieu operates a family member's food business.  The primary source of income for the business comes from making and selling a variety of food products in the local community.  Lieu has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, Lieu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lieu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products for saL..  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase more raw ingredients as before.  The will be their 5th loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lieu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Hoa (301012) is a 39 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business of making & selling food.


2.  C. T. N. (301036) is a 50 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business of making & selling food.


3.  L. T. Loi (301120) is a 32 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

1.  L. T. Hoa (301012) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  C. T. N. (301036) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  L. T. Loi (301120) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario del poblado de mina el limón,
Es Pensionado, actualmente trabaja como fiscal en la procesadora de arroz de san Isidro al productor, Noel Pastora, su esposa es maestra actualmente pensionada, y siempre ha mantenido una continuidad de préstamos con la empresa y de esa manera a mejorado su nivel de vida
texts.en:
This client is from the town of Mina el Limón. He receives a pension, and he currently works as an attorney for the San Isidro rice processor. The producer is Noel Pastora. His wife, a teacher, currently receives a pension. They have always maintained a continuity of loans with the business, and that way they have improved their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy door, window, and plaster

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Esta cliente se dedica a la venta de comida, fresco gaseosa dulces como arroz en leche, atolillos cajetas en su casa de habitación, tiene diez años de experiencia en el negocio y el crédito lo necesita para poder cubrir un encargo de treinta servicios de comida extra  que le esta contratando una institución para su personal por lo tanto tiene que invertir para poder cumplir con el pedido y poder dar respuesta a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This client sells food, soft drinks, sweets like “arroz en leche” (rice in milk), hot drinks, and caramels in her house. She has ten years of experience in the business. She needs the loan to be able to cover the cost of an order to provide service for 30 extra meals. An institution wants to contract her to provide this service. She needs to make purchases to be able to fill the order and give an answer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her eatery

loans.name: Las 3 Mujeres Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las 3 Marías lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es María Mercedes L. S. quien desde hace aproximadamente 11 años vende ropa usada. Esta señora de 55 años recuerda como si fuera ayer como en  1999 compro su primera paca de ropa usada la cual en ese entonces costaba 600 córdobas y  es con esta con la que inicia su pequeña tienda. 

En la actualidad ella tiene un local más amplio, cuenta con dos  trabajadores que vende ambulante y compra las pacas de ropa clasificada la cual tiene un valor de 8,000 córdobas. Ella con el préstamo invertirá en una mercadería especialmente para la temporada de verano.

Las otras integrantes son la joven María de los Ángeles H. quien vende prendas de plata skilo desde hace cuatro años y María Elena L. quien comercializa nacatamales. Ellas invertirán en sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The “Las 3 Marías” (The 3 Marys) group is made up of three, hard-working women; one of whom is María Mercedes L. S., who has sold clothes for 11 years approximately. She is 55 years old and remembers 1999 as if it were yesterday, when she bought her first bundle of used clothing, which back then cost 600 córdobas; this is how she first set up her small store. She currently has a more spacious locale and two employees that sell door-to-door. She buys bundles of classified clothing valued at 8,000 córdobas. She will use the requested funds to buy stock merchandise, especially summer items. The other members of the group are: María de los Ángeles H., who has sold silver jewelry for four years and María Elena L., who sells nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamale). They will invest the funds in their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy P. is from the village of Danao. She is 32 years old, married and has 5 infants. To make a living, Daisy owns & operates a fishing business. The primary source of income is from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish to the local community. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2002, Daisy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Daisy's 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: 03.01.06 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en: Ha L. T. (26) is a 45-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa, Thanh Hoa. Ha is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 03.01.06 Hoang Hoa Group. Ha is married and has four school-aged children. She operates a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month. In 2004, Ha joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ha is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 7th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. L. T. Lap (63) is a 31-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. 2. C. T. Thang (5) is a 37-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. 3. L. T. Hoan (38) is a 26-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ha L. T. (26) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa, Thanh Hoa. Ha là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03,01,06 Hoang Hoa (03,01,06 Hoang Hoa). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hải sản như cá và tôm trong cộng đồng địa phương. Ha thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Ha kiếm được khoảng 1,200,000 VND. Vào 2004, Ha đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Ha đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L. T. Lap (63) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 2. C. T. Thang (5) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 3. L. T. Hoan (38) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Silvia Rufina

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario de telica se dedica a la venta de productos Eskimos en todas sus presentaciones, su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación telcor telica ½ c al oeste, es casada su marido trabaja en la alcaldía del mismo municipio,
texts.en:
This client is from Telica. She sells ice cream products. Her business is located in her home, which is ½ block west of Telcor Telica. She is married, and her husband works in the mayor’s office in the same municipality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dairy products (ice cream)

loans.name: Lluvia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lluvia está integrado por tres féminas trabajadoras las cuales han sido beneficiadas por kiva anteriormente. La coordinadora de este grupo es la señora Lorena del Socorro Calderón quien desde hace 8 años con unos ahorros compro maíz y leña con lo que empezó su negocio de tortillas.

Ella  por medio de los préstamos ha ido diversificando y aumentando su negocio ya que actualmente además de vender tortillas, comercializa frijoles cocidos y cuajadas.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Flor de María Umaña  la cual tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en alimentos  fritos y Martha Lorena M. quien es propietaria de un cafetín.
texts.en:
The group, "Lluvia" (rain) is made up of three hard working ladies who have benefited from Kiva in the past. Lorena is the group's coordinator who eight years ago used her savings to buy corn and firewood and began her tortilla business. She, with the help of previous loans, began diversifying and growing her business. Now, in addition to tortillas, she also sells cooked beans and milk curd. The other members of the group include: Flor, who has a small fry restaurant, a popular type of restaurant that specializes in fried food; and Martha who has a small café.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Romilyn

texts.en: Romilyn F. is from the village of Danao. She is 21 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Romilyn owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Romilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her first from PMPC. Romilyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Fatima Maria

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario de la cuidad de león, actualmente está trabajando en el centro de salud de telica, desempeñándose como enfermera auxiliar, es casada,
texts.en:
This client is from the city of León. She currently works in the Telica Health Center. She works as nurse’s aide. She is married.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room, floor, and ceiling

loans.name: Francela Group

texts.es:
El grupo Francela está integrado por Juana Isabel F. C., Olivia Antonia R. O. y Nora del Socorro O. Z.. La señora F. C. es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella comenzó con un pequeño comedor en Bello Horizonte, zona comercial de Managua donde la primera vez que abrió solo vendió dos platos de comida según comento.

Actualmente ella trabaja en su casa en San Judas y distribuye los alimentos entre sus clientes. Con el crédito comprara una refrigeradora que le permitirá mantener parte de la materia prima.
 
Sus compañeras de grupo son Olivia R. quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 35 años y Nora del Socorro O. la cual vende de pollo tiene una refresquería donde produce siete distintos frescos. Ellas invertirán el crédito en Este grupo tienen cinco ciclos de préstamos trabajando con Adim y uno de ellos con Kiva.
texts.en:
The members of the Francela group are: Juana Isabel F. C., Olivia Antonia R. O. and Nora del Socorro O. Z.; Mrs. F. C. is group president. She started off with a small eatery in Bello Horizonte, a commercial area in Managua, where she tells us that, when she first opened, she only sold two servings. She now works from her home in San Judas and delivers the meals to her customers. She will use the funds to buy a refrigerator that will make it possible for her to store her perishables. Her fellow group members are Olivia R., who has had a small grocery store for 35 years and Nora del Socorro O., who sells chicken and has a beverage stand where she sells seven different kinds of fruit drink. They will invest the funds in their businesses. This group has had five loan cycles with Adim, one of which was with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es: El negocio que posee el señor
texts.en:
The business that Mr. Alvarez has is photocopying and graphic design. He practically supports himself from this business because he doesn’t have young children (they are already married) so the earnings are for himself. He is asking for a loan from CEPRODEL to buy toner, inks, and the rest will be used to finish off paying for a printer

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toner, inks and the remainder will be used to finish paying for a printer

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is one of the oldest loyal borrower's of FATEN. She and her husband started taking loans 10 years ago to start their own workshop where they make wooden crosses and statues. Her husband shapes them and she paints, sticks pieces together and manages selling and dealing with customers.

Her husband started this business with his nephew. By the time he could save enough money to rent his own workshop and start making his own production, the workshop grew. Now Wafa is taking a loan from FATEN to buy olive tree wood since their work prospers in summer, which is the tourism season in the Bethlehem area.

Wafa stands in the workshop showing some of their products.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like olive wood

loans.name: Audeli Paublina

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario de telica, tiene un negocio de comideria, es casada y ha sido cliente activo de esta empresa ceprodel, de las cuales ha mejorado su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This client is from Telica. She is married, has an eatery and has been an active member of Ceprodel. Its loans have improved her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install wood decorative touches on her wall.

loans.name: El Gato Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Gato es un nuevo grupo que está integrado por  cuatro personas trabajadoras quienes desean mejorar sus negocios ellos son Dulce María F.,  Deyanira del Carmen G. V., Jorge Antonio M. W. y Xiomara del Socorro V. S..

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora F. quien vende cosméticos desde hace tres años cuyo negocio comenzó con unos ahorros y el cual ha ido creciendo es por ello que necesita el crédito para surtir a sus clientes. 
Sus compañeros de grupo son; Deyanira del Carmen G. V. quien vende cosméticos, Jorge Antonio M. W. tiene una pulpería  y Xiomara del Socorro V. S. es dueña de una estética de belleza.
texts.en:
The “El Gato” (The Cat) group is a new group and is composed of four, hard-working persons who wish to improve their businesses: Dulce María F., Deyanira del Carmen G. V., Jorge Antonio M. W. and Xiomara del Socorro V. S.. Mrs. F. is the group coordinator; she has sold cosmetics for the last three years. She began her business using some of her savings and she has gradually been increasing it. She needs funds to be able to supply her customers. Her fellow group members are Deyanira del Carmen G. V., who sells cosmetics, Jorge Antonio M. W., who has a grocery store, and Xiomara del Socorro V. S., who owns a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario de Telica Departamento de León, actualmente está trabajando en el Mined Telica, desempeñándose como Asesor Pedagógica
texts.en:
This client is from Telica, León department. She is employed by Telica's Ministry of Education as an Educational Advisor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario de la comarca los cocos, jurisdicción de telica , casada y trabaja en el mined telica desempeñándose como asesora pedagógica
texts.en:
This client is from the Los Cocos community, Telica jurisdiction. She's married and is employed as an Educational Advisor by Telica's Ministry of Education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay off a department store debt.

loans.name: Decididas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Decididas  lo integran tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es  Yolanda del Carmen Solórzano quien es la coordinadora del grupo. Según comento Solórzano todo inicio  con la venta de carne y luego fue variando en cuanto a los productos que realiza y comercializa.  Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de carne. 
Las otras dos integrantes son Claudia Leticia Gómez de 32 años quien destaza cerdo y vende nacatamales, un plato típico nicaragüense y Elizabeth del Carmen Ortiz comercializa cosméticos. Ellas invertirán el crédito en materia prima para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The “Decididas” (Determined Ones) group is composed of three, hard-working women; one of whom is Yolanda del Carmen Solórzano, who is the group coordinator. According to her, everything started with meat sales; she gradually varied the products that she sells. She will use this loan to buy meat. The other group members are Claudia Leticia Gómez, 32, who butchers pork and sells nacatamales (traditional Nicaraguan tamale) and Elizabeth del Carmen Ortiz, who sells cosmetics. They will invest their funds in raw materials for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margarita De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario de la comarca Rigoberto morales chavez, actualmente trabaja en el instituto señor de esquípulas, desempeñándose como secretaria
Es casada.
texts.en:
This client is from the Rigoberto Morales Chavez area. She is employed as a secretary at the Señor de Esquípulas Institute. She is married.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For Home Improvements.

loans.name: Janett

texts.es:
Janett M. en el 2000 inicio un pequeño negocio de comida donde empezó  vendiendo  enchiladas para ver si el negocio era viable y luego como vio que había mucho movimiento instalo su comideria en la cual trabaja junto con su hermana y una sobrina.
Actualmente invertirá el crédito para alquilar un lugar en masachapa y aprovechar esta semana mayor para comercializar diferentes tipos de comida en ese lugar.
texts.en:
Janett M. opened a small food business in 2000; she started out selling enchiladas to see if the business was viable and then, seeing that there was a lot of movement, set up her eatery where she works with her sister and a niece. She will use the funds to rent a space in Masachapa so that she can take advantage of Holy Week to sell various kinds of meals there.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and rent a space in Masachapa.

loans.name: Juana Marizol

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario de Telica Departamento de León, actualmente está trabajando en el Mined Telica, desempeñándose como Asesor Pedagógica, es casada
texts.en:
This client is from Telica, León department. She is employed as an Educational Advisor by Telica's Ministry of Education. She is married.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay of a department store debt.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Diana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Diana del Socorro Blandón G. comercializa vigoron comida típica que consiste en yuca cosida, chicharrón y ensalada de repollo. Ella inicio vendiendo en las aceras de registro civil en una pequeña mesa con libra y media de chicharrón.
Hoy en día tiene su propio local con cinco mesas, bien ordenado y comercializa más variedad de comidas. Ella con el préstamo comprara más sillas y mesas además de invertir en la producción.
texts.en:
Diana del Socorro Blandón G. sells Vigorón, a traditional dish comprised of cooked manioc, fried pork rinds and coleslaw. She started out selling on the sidewalk, outside the municipal public records office, with a little table and a pound and a half of chicharron. Now, she has her own, well organized, space with five tables and she sells a wider variety of dishes. She will use the funds to buy more tables and chairs as well as invest in ingredients for her production.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and make improvements to her locale.

loans.name: Jessie Enett

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario de León, actualmente está trabajando en el Mined Telica, desempeñándose como Asesor Pedagógica, es casada
texts.en:
This client is from León. She is employed by Telica's Ministry of Education as an Educational Advisor. She's married.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a porch.

loans.name: 02.09.04 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en: Dan L. T. (209016) is a 42-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa, Thanh Hoa. Dan is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02,09,04 Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa (02.09.04 Hoang Hoa). Dan is married and has four school-aged children. She operates a business planting and harvesting rice for saL.. She has been engaged in this business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month. In 2003, Dan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Dan is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her 7th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. C. T. Toi (209017) is a 51-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising crops. 2. C. T. Thuy (209021) is a 29-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business. 3. N. T. Thang (209022) is a 49-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising crops. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Dan L. T. (209016) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa. Dan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02,09,04 Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa (02,09,04 Hoang Hoa). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ trồng & thu hoạch gạo để bán. Dan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 18 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Dan kiếm được khoảng 1,000,000 VND. Vào 2003, Dan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Dan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua hạt giống bổ sung, cây giống & cây con để trồng. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. C. T. Toi (209017) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực. 2. C. T. Thuy (209021) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc. 3. N. T. Thang (209022) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind and her husband own a shoe store in Bethlehem city. They started working in this field 20 years ago. They have seven children who are all college or school students.

They sell women, men and kid's shoes in their store. Hind helps her husband run the store, especially in the high seasons, which are usually summer and feasts. This is not Hind's first loan from FATEN. She is one of the most committed borrowers. She is taking this loan to purchase, in cash, summer stock goods as they are expecting it to be a good season as usual.

Hind and her husband appear in their store in the picture above.

loans.use: To purchase summer stock

loans.name: Argentina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es una maestra que tiene 17 años de impartir clases y está ubicada en el colegio Miguel Ángel Ortez 
Habita en la comunidad Rigoberto Morales ,atravez de los créditos ha venido construyendo y mejorando su casa
También ha ayudado a preparar académicamente a sus familiares.
También les ha dado preparación académica a sus hijos
Y crearles mejores condiciones donde vive
texts.en:
This client has been a teacher for 17 years at the Miguel Ángel Ortez school. She lives in the Rigoberto Morales community. The loans have made it possible for her to improve the conditions of her home as well as helped her to meet educational expenses of her relatives and her children. They have also created better living conditions where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To paint her house and buy furniture.

loans.name: Teresita's Group

texts.en: Teresita P. is from the village of Mocag, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 55 years old. Teresita is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Teresita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rhenee

texts.en: Rhenee P. believes that poverty is not a hindrance to one’s success. Being a member of ASHI, Kiva's field partner in the Philippines, she feels privileged for having such great help. Through the financial assistance offered by the institution, she has been able to start an inland fish culture and has the ability to support her rice farming business. Proceeds from these businesses have been the source for Rhenee’s family to obtain their basic needs and improve their quality of life; at this point, their only 13-year-old child is not yet incurring a large amount of money for his education. However, Rhenee still wants to save some of her profit to be able to send her child to a high standard school for good quality education in college. With her husband partnering her in the business, Rhenee is requesting a larger loan to purchase materials for manufacturing a “balsa” (raft) to be used for fishing and to increase the volume of fish they farm. In so doing, they will be able to supply their customers' increasing demands and increase their profit.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making a raft for fishing

loans.name: Dolores' Group

texts.en:
Dolores D. L. is from the town of Villa Marzo Cordon. She is forty-three years old. Dolores is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Dolores D. L.'s group.

Dolores is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Dolores owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Dolores has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Dolores joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dolores has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. She used this previous loan to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Dolores is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be Dolores's fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-nine branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru: Саидкулов Икром проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 26 лет. Холост. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает стройматериалы на рынке "Дехкон". Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота. Икром хочет расширить свой бизнес. Он намерен открыть собственный магазин.
texts.en:
Ikrom S. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 26 years old. He is a bachelor. He has secondary education. He has been in the retail business for more than five years. He mainly sells building materials on the Dehkon market. He is taking out the loan to increase sales. Ikrom wants to expand his business. He plans to open his own store.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales volume

loans.name: Sam Art

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam Art Y. is 52 years old and is a villager who lives in Svay Chuor village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Sokhak Nget, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow crops to earn a living.

In this farming, they face a problem because the field is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Sam Art Y. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water pump and gasoline to pump water to support her farm crops.

Mrs. Sam Art Y. is the mother of three children who all are students in the local school and also support their parents’ farming. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and gasoline

loans.name: Shiden's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Shiden S. is from Kampong Svay village in Kandal province. She is 60 years old and is the village bank president of her group, which consists of twenty-four members, who are the subject of this loan offered by AMK. Each member of this village loan will use it to purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Shiden S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from farming, she is also a pig breeder who is able to make a small income to support her family.

Since, Mrs. Shiden S.’s pig business is going well she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets to enlarge her business.

Mrs. Shiden S. is a widow with six childR., four of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory and the other two stay at home and also support their mother’s business.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Ye's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Vannak N. is a group leader of four people who all live in Chrouy Ampil village in Kandal province and they will use the loan in different purposes. She is a clothe seller. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more clothes to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Chou Sophara, is a construction worker who could earn a little income to support the family. Mrs. Vannak N. is a mother of three children two of whom are attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy an engine for her husband's fishing boat

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun S. is villager who lives in Kaoh K. Leu village in Kandal province. She is 53 years old and is the leader of her group loan, that consists of nine members, offered by AMK. Each member will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Oun S. and her husband, Mr. Sary Lorn, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow crops. Although they try to work hard with their farm, they still earn less income than needed to support the family living. Mrs. Oun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy an engine for a fishing boat to support her husband’s new business.

This couple has six children, five or whom are employed in different business such as seamstress, construction worker and laborer, while the last one is a student in the local school.
