Gorette is 26 years old and married with four children who are between 1 and 8 years old.  Gorette sells clothes, mainly women's clothing.  She has been in this business for a long time and the hours of her business are from 7 am to 9 pm every day. 

Gorette is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by adding a variety of styles such as men and children's clothing. With this loan, Gorette has a vision of purchasing large bales of clothing for wholesaling and retailing at the same time so that her revenue will increase.  If successful, she hopes to continue building a secure future for her family. In addition, she will help the people from her community by creating jobs for them.

loans.use: To buy men and children's clothing to resell

loans.name: Ndolo

texts.en: Ndolo S. is 39 years old and makes a living selling clothes. His business is located at Gikomba, a very busy open air market in Nairobi. He has been in business for the last 10 years and reports that profits are strong. However, he says that customers want more choice because many sellers in this market offer similar items. He works very hard at his business so that he can take care of his four children, and is humble, caring and hardworking. Ndolo has applied for a loan of Kes 60,000 to buy a motor bike to transport clothing to different parts of town.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport clothing around town

loans.name: Burulkan's Group

texts.ru:
Для того чтобы добиться успеха в жизни, и достичь поставленных целей, человек изначально должен быть готов пойти на определённые жертвы. Как говорится в таких случаях: В любом деле, нужен вклад, чтобы был результат. Бурулкан Аманова– лидер группы. Она проживает в с. Кочкорке, в сердце самой республики. Бурулкан сорок семь лет. Муж Бурулкан – член фермерского хозяйства. Вместе они вырастили двоих детей. Старшая дочка уже окончила институт и работает. Сын в данное время является студентом национального университета. Чтобы оплатить контракт детей в институте, Бурулкан и её мужу пришлось изрядно потрудиться, однако они, зная всю степень значимости получения образования, до сих пор делают всё возможное, чтобы дать детям шанс пробиться в люди. В данное время, Бурулкан перепродаёт скот и торгует мясом. Этим делом она уже занимается на протяжении одиннадцати лет. В 1998 – году Бурулкан вместе с мужем продали корову за пятнадцать тысяч сомов ($300) и вложили деньги в этот бизнес. Сейчас их доход составляет двадцать тысяч сомов ($400) ежемесячно. Годы кропотливого труда позволили Бурулкан не только дать образование детям, но также приобрести дом в пригороде Бишкека, что является мечтой любой кыргызской семьи. Сейчас Бурулкан требуется финансовая поддержка. Она надеется получить этот кредит и купить барана для дальнейшей перепродажи. Она также хочет посредством прибыли с бизнеса и приготовить приданое дочери. 

Партнёры Бурулкан по группе:

Кулусун Амановой пятьдесят один год. Кулусун – мать шестерых детей: троих сыновей и трёх дочерей. Старшие дети уже выросли и живут отдельно. Младший сын и дочь помогают ей по хозяйству. Кулусун ранее получила кредит и купила скот для откорма перепродажи. Она решила ещё раз получить кредит и купить барана. Это дело приносит ей восемь тысяч сомов в месяц. 

Назгул Балтабаевой двадцать шесть лет. Она уже мать четверых детей. Назгул вместе с мужем откармливает скот и перепродаёт. Их ежемесячная прибыль от этого бизнеса составляет около восьми тысяч сомов. Они надеются получить кредит и вложить средства в закупку одного барана. 

Кылычбеку Терекбаеву сорок лет. Кылычбек – отец троих детей. Двое из детей ходят в школу, и Кылычбек прикладывает все усилия, чтобы дети одевались не хуже других детей. Жена сидит дома с самым младшим сыном, которому всего год. Кылычбеку нужен кредит, чтобы купить одного барана. Кылычбек делает всё, чтобы улучшить жилищные условия.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
In order to achieve success in life and achieve set goals, a person has to be ready for certain sacrifices. There is a saying for these situations: every business requires an investment in order to have a result. Burulkan A. is the leader of this group. She lives in the town of Kochkor, in the heart of the republic. Burulkan is forty-seven years old. Her husband is a member of a farm collective. Together, they raised two children. The oldest daughter already finished a university and is now working. The son is currently a student at the national university. In order to pay for their children’s education, Burulkan and her husband has to work very hard; however, they knew the importance of getting an education and still do everything possible to give their children opportunities to succeed in life. Currently, Burulkan resells livestock and sells meat. She has been involved in this business for eleven years. In 1998, Burulkan and her husband sols a cow for fifteen thousand som ($300) and invested the money into this business. Now, their monthly income is twenty thousand som ($400). Years of hard work allowed Burulkan not only to provide education for her children, but also to purchase a house in the suburb of Bishkek, which is a dream of any Kyrgyz family. Now, Burulkan needs financial support. She hopes to obtain this loan and buy a sheep for subsequent resale. She also wants to use the resulting profit and prepare a dowry for her daughter. Burulkan’s group partners are: Kulusun A. is fifty-one years old. She is a mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. The youngest son and daughter help her with the household. Kulusun previously obtained a loan and bought livestock for fattening and resale. She decided to request another loan and buy a sheep. This business yields her eight thousand som per month. Nazgul B. is twenty-six years old. She is already a mother of four children. Nazgul and her husband fatten livestock and resell it. Their monthly profit from this business is close to eight thousand som. They hope to obtain a loan and invest the money into the purchase of one sheep. Kylychbek Terekbaeva is forty years old. He is a father of three children. Two of them go to school, and Kylychbek puts all of his efforts toward keeping his children dressed well. His wife stays home with the youngest son, who is only one years old. Kylychbek needs a loan to buy one sheep. He does everything possible in order to improve his living conditions.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sheep for subsequent resale

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is 39 years old and married without children. Elie’s wife does not work. Elie owns a business selling green potatoes in the market of Nyagahunga center. Elie has been in the business for three years. This business is profitable for him so he can get all their basic needs. His business is well organized and well known in his region, which is a stimulus for him.


Elie is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to grow his business by adding large quantities of green potatoes for sale. This increase in quantities will help him attract more customers, which is the way to obtain more profit. With this loan, Elie expects to reinvest the profits in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more green potatoes for sale

loans.name: Jokudu

texts.en:
Jokudu F. is 38 years old and widowed. She has four children who all go to school. She is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay her children's school fees.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Nurzat's Group

texts.ru:
Герои нашей истории являются примером огромного оптимизма и сильной веры в себя и собственные силы. Они, прежде чем идти на риск просчитывают все шаги, только после этого принимают окончательное решение. Нурзат Ашырова– лидер группы. Некоторое время назад она овдовела, и ей пришлось в одиночку воспитывать троих детей. Старшей дочке сейчас восемнадцать. Она учится на первом курсе в университете. Среднему сыну тринадцать. Он и его младшая сестра, которой девять лет, учатся в школе. После потери мужа Нурзат столкнулась с жестокой действительностью воспитывать детей в одиночку. И вот здесь Нурзат помогла заложенная в ней черта – рассудительность и холодный ум. Не смотря на то, что она работала медсестрой в больнице, Нурзат смело занялась скотоводством. Жаловаться на судьбу было некогда. Надо было трудиться за троих и быстро вставать на ноги. Успех не заставил себя ждать. Ей удалось увеличить поголовье скота, а заодно и прибыль от продажи скота. Всё это позволило ей не только обеспечить достойную жизнь самой себе и счастливое детство детям, но также отправить дочку на учёбу в столицу. К тому же уже подрос сын и он активно помогает маме готовить корм и ухаживать за скотом. Сейчас Нурзат требуется небольшая помощь. Ей нужен кредит, чтобы купить одну корову продавать в дальнейшем молоко.    

Партнёры Нурзат по группе:

Калиман Ажибаевой пятьдесят лет. Калиман по профессии медсестра. Её муж всю жизнь проработал чабаном. Вместе они вырастили семерых детей, четверо из которых уже имеют свои семьи и живут отдельно. Двое младших до сих пор живут с Калиман. Калиман решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы купить четырёх баранов. 

Бурул Султановой тридцать восемь лет. Бурул разведена. У неё семнадцатилетняя дочь, которая учится в техникуме в г. Токмок. Сама Бурул продаёт продукты питания, а также товары широкого потребления. Доход Бурул составляет около десяти тысяч сомов. Бурул хочется увеличить ассортимент, так это привлекало бы больше покупателей. Она надеется получить этот кредит и закупить товар.

Бактыгул Акматовой сорок лет. Её муж работает ветеринаром. Бактыгул растит четверых детей. Помимо работы ветеринаром, муж Бактыгул также занимается животноводством. Старшие дети помогают отцу, и по мере того как они растут, растут и расходы семьи. Бактыгул нуждается в кредите, который позволил бы ей купить четырёх баранов.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Nurzat Ashyrova is the group leader. She is a widow that raised her three children on her own. Her eldest daughter is now eighteen and a freshman at the university. Her middle son is thirteen and her youngest daughter is nine and both are in school. Although she used to work as a nurse in the hospital, Nurzat decided to raise cattle. She managed to increase the number of livestock, and as well as make a profit from the sale of her livestock. All this allowed her to provide a decent life for herself and her children, but also to send her daughter to study in the capital. Her son actively helps her prepare food and care for livestock. Nurzat is asking for a loan to buy a cow to increase milk production.

Nurzat’s Partners in the group:

Kaliman A. is fifty years and a nurse. Her husband worked as a shepherd all his life. Together they raised seven children, four of whom already have their own households separately. The two younger children still live with Kaliman. Kaliman decided to apply for a loan to buy four rams.

Burul S. is thirty-eight years old and a divorced, single mother. She has a seventeen-year daughter who is studying in college in Tokmok. Burul sells groceries. The revenue Burul makes is about ten thousand soms. Burul want to increase the variety of goods, so it will attract more clients. She hopes to get the loan to purchase additional goods.

Baktygul A. is forty years old with four children. Her husband is a veterinarian and they are raising cattle. Baktygulov is asking for a loan to buy four rams.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase livestock and goods

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan G. is 20 years old and single. She is currently in the business of selling bedsheets and dresses at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bedsheets and dresses to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a hotel.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bedsheets and dresses to sell

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah W. K. is 36 years old, married and has two children, who are 13 and five years old. For the last six years, she has made a living running a general store where she sells household items, beverages and hair products. Her business is located at a place called Ruiru in Thika town. She has applied for a loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers and to open outlets in other parts of the town. She is a very hardworking businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 30 years old, married with five children and she takes care of two dependents.  Beatha has been working as a businesswoman wholesaling a variety of goods mainly cooking oil, rice, sweets, covered water, etc.  She has been in this business for about one year and the hours of her business are from 6 am to 8 pm every day.

Beatha is now requesting a Kiva loan so that she can expand her shop by adding cosmetic goods and increasing the quantity of foodstuffs like sugar, rice, different types of flours and some other goods that seem to be highly demanded in her business area. With this loan, Beatha hopes that she will be able to satisfy the needs of her customers and hopefully her sales will increase as well as her profits.  If successful, she will start saving as well as reinvesting in her business with one portion of the earned profits.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like sugar, rice and different types of flours

loans.name: Raja

texts.en:
Raja C. is 40 years old and married to a peasant. She has four children who all go to school. She is currently in the business of selling groundnut and maize flour at the market and is requesting a loan to stock pulses to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock pulses to sell

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 37 years old, married with two children and she takes care of two dependents.  Vestine is commonly known as a wholesaler in her business area.  The goods, which she wholesales, are cosmetic goods like body lotion, toothpaste, flour soap etc.  She has been in this business for about two years and the hours of her business are from early in the morning until late in the evening hours.

Vestine needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can expand her business by adding more cosmetic goods for wholesale.  With these additional goods to sell at wholesale, Vestine hopes to satisfy the needs of her retailers.  If successful, Vestine will earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to continue taking care of her children as well as her two dependents.  In addition, she will start to save for the future reinvestment of her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic goods like body lotion, toothpaste, flour soap etc.

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji S. is 31 years old and married to a driver. She has three children who all go to school. She is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut paste at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build up a restaurant.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen A. is 29 years old and married to a peasant. She has two children who go to school. She is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal from home, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a charcoal store.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 54 years old and is married with four children who are 16, 18, 21 and 23 years old. Dina is a proven entrepreneur dealing in the sale of clothing items: mainly fabrics for clothes and some other items needed in sewing various styles of clothes. She has been in this business for about fifteen years and the hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Dina is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can expand her business by adding more clothing items for sale which, hopefully, will allow her to satisfy the demands of her customers. Through this satisfaction, she will continue paying school fees for her children and providing more food for them. In addition, she will keep making some savings for further reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and other items needed for sewing clothes

loans.name: Jeannine

texts.fr: Née en 1981 à Siwèzo Zoungodo au Bénin, K. Jeannine est mariée à DOVONON Boniface et est mère de deux enfants dont un est scolarisé. La famille réside au quartier Gbowèlè à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique depuis quatre ans. Jeannine supporte avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Depuis 22 ans, Jeannine vend de poudre à Allada, Sékou et Glo. Jeannine s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Jeannine a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien effectué le remboursement. Jeannine désire renforcer son activité et accroître sa clientèle, en vue de se faire plus de profits. C'est pour cette raison que Jeannine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un second prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1981 in Siwèzo Zoungodo in Bénin, Jeannine K. is married to Boniface DOVONON and is mother to two children, one of whom is at school. The family has lived for the past four years in the Gbowèlè district of Allada, in the "département" (administrative district) of Atlantique. Jeannine shares responsibility for the family's expenses with her husband. For the past 22 years, she has been selling talcum powder in Allada, Sékou and Glo. She gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Jeannine has had one loan from ALIDé, which she repaid correctly. She would like to strengthen her business and expand her customer base, in order to make more money. It is for this reason that she is applying for a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two bags of talcum powder

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 22 years old and she is still single. She is well-known as a young entrepreneur selling a variety of clothes, mainly women’s clothes. This is her second successful year in this business which she operates from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Clarisse is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through adding a variety of styles such as men’s clothes as well as children’s clothes. With this additional business, she will hopefully earn more profits than previously.

With the increased profits, one portion will be used in building a secure future for her future family as she has a boyfriend ready to marry her, and the other portion will be used for further reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: To add a variety of styles such as men's and children's clothes

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
Redempta is 36 years old and is married with four children who are 3, 5, 10 and 13 years old. She is well-known as a wholesaler of sweets (candies). She has been in this business for about two years and she operates her business from early in the morning until late in the evening hours. She struggles much in her daily business so that she can get food for her children.

Redempta needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can expand her business by adding the wholesale of cookies, biscuits and some other pastries. In addition, with this loan, she will start wholesaling soft drinks like soda, juice etc.

If successful, Redempta will continue taking care of her children as well as building a secure future for them. In addition she will start saving for further reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: To add the wholesale of cookies, biscuits and some other pastries

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is 29 years old and is single. He is a self-employed businessman selling a variety of goods in his shop. Those goods include electronic and electrical items as the photo indicate. Included are power bars, simple radio receivers, etc. Valens has been in this business for about seven years and his is usually open from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day.

Valens needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Compny in order to expand his store by adding more hardware iterms to his shop. With these additional goods, he hopes that he will attract more customers and his sales will increase as well as his profits.

With the extra profits, Valens will keep reinvesting in his business for the purpose of being financially stable and he will also start saving for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic and electrical items

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 24 years old and is married with one kid of 3 months.

Susan is a self-employed businesswoman selling spare parts in her area. The entrepreneurs of this area are interested in selling spare parts as they are purchased more often than other goods. Susan has been in this business for about a year and her shop is open from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Since her customers keep increasing beyond her selling capacity, Susan needs to request a Kiva loan which will allow her to expand her shop by adding a variety of spare parts, mainly those which are in high demand by her customers.

With this additional business, Susan will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow her to start reserving for future reinvestment in her business as well as for the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: To add a variety of spare parts

loans.name: Nura

texts.en:
Nura R. is 41 years old and widowed. She has four children who all go to school. She is currently in the business of selling tea on the street in the evening, and is requesting a loan to stock more sugar and milk to make tea to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more sugar and milk to make tea to sell

loans.name: Elvire

texts.fr: Née en 1984 à Sakété au Bénin, L. Elvire est mariée à AKPATA Joseph et est mère de deux enfants. Le couple a deux autres enfants à leurs charges. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Elvire vit avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Kpakpakanmè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Elvire vit dans ce quartier depuis quatre ans et vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les charges familiales. Elvire est une coiffeuse. Elvire a son atelier de coiffure à son domicile et elle vend également des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Elvire s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Elvire exerce cette activité depuis sept ans. C'est la première fois que Elvire sollicite de prêt à ALIDé, en vue de rehausser son activité et de se faire plus de revenu.
texts.en:
Born in 1984 in Sakété in Bénin, Elvire L. is married to Joseph AKPATA and is mother to two children. The couple have two other children in their care. Some of the children are at school. Elvire lives with her children and her husband in the Kpakpakanmé district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She has lived in this district for the past four years and helps her husband to cover the family expenses. Elvire is a hairdresser. She has her hairdressing salon at home and also sells hairpieces and cosmetics. She gets her stocks at Dantokpa, the international market in Bénin. Elvire has been carrying out this activity for seven years. She is applying for the first time for a loan from ALIDé, in order to expand her activity and make more money.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hairpieces and cosmetics

loans.name: Kiki

texts.en:
Kiki A. is 42 years old and married to a peasant. She has four children who all go to school. She is currently in the business of selling bedsheets in her shop, and is requesting a loan to stock more bedsheets to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to continue sending her children to school.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Modi

texts.en:
Modi P. is 47 years old and widowed. She has seven children and they do not go to school. She is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal in wholesale, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a charcoal store.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Née en 1964 à Bohicon dans le département du Zou, H. Madeleine est mariée à ZINSOU Aimé, un chauffeur. Le couple à sept enfants à charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Dégakon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis sept ans. Pour prendre soin de ses enfants, Madeleine vend des produits vivriers et de l'huile à son domicile. C'est à Parakou au Nord du Bénin, que Madeleine achète ses produits. Madeleine exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans et a obtenu déjà une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de se faire plus de profit, Madeleine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1964 in Bohicon in the "département" (administrative district) of Zou, Madeleine is married to Aimé ZINSOU, a driver. The couple have seven children in their care, of which two are their own children. All the children have attended school. The family has lived for the past seven years in the Dégakon district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. In order to take care of her children, Madeleine sells farmed food products and oil from home. She buys her products in Parakou in the north of Bénin. She has been carrying out this activity for five years and has already had a loan from ALIDé. With a view to strengthening her business and making more money, Madeleine is applying for a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals and peanut oil

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Née en 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Julienne est mariée à HOUSSOU Gaspard et est mère de deux enfants. Le couple à trois autres enfants à leurs charges. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Il y a près de six ans que la famille s'est installée au quartier Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Julienne n'a pas été à l'école. Depuis huit ans, Julienne mène comme activité, la vente de pâtes dentifrices et des produits de soins à Agbangandan. Julienne s'approvisionne au marché de Houègbo et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Julienne a bénéficié une fois déjà de prêt à ALIDé et a bien effectué les remboursements. Julienne sollicite un second prêt de ALIDé, afin de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, Julienne A. is married to Gaspard HOUSSOU and has two children. The couple have three other children in their care. Some of the children are at school. Almost six years ago the family settled down in the Agblangandan district of the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. The couple share responsibility for the various family expenses. Julienne did not go to school. For the past eight years she has been selling toothpaste and healthcare products in Agbangdan. She gets her supplies in the market at Houègbo and also in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Julienne has already had one loan from ALIDé and repaid it without incident. She is applying for a second loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen her business and respond better to customer demand.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toothpaste and healthcare products

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: LA SR. SILVIA Y SU ESPOSO ANDRES VIVEN EN LA ZONA DE BAJO PAMPAHASI QUE SE ENCUENTRA A TREINTA MINUTOS DEL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD. SILVIA ES UNA PERSONA JOVEN Y MUY TRABAJADORA, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE EDREDONES Y COLCHAS DE POLAR, ELLA COMENZÓ CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD GRACIAS A SUS PADRES Y HERMANOS QUE SE DEDICAN A LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD. UNA VES QUE HA CONFECIONADO VARIAS COLCHAS Y EDREDONES LOS ENVÍA A LA CIUDAD DE BERMEJO. ANDRES TRABAJA CON SU MINIBUS COMO TRANSPORTE PÚBLICO, ÉL ESTA AFILIADO AL GRUPO CUATRO "LEONES" DEL SINDICATO DE TRANSPORTES VIRGEN DE FÁTIMA, CADA SINDICATO TIENE VARIOS GRUPOS LOS CUALES ESTAN CONFORMADOS POR VARIOS SOCIOS PROPIETARIOS Y ASALARIADOS. ESTA ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE ELLOS SOLICITAN UN CRÉDITO CON NUESTRA INSTITUCIÓN Y VINIERON POR RECOMENSACION DE OTRO CLIENTE QUE LOS RECOMENDO CON NOSOTROS. SILVIA Y SU ESPOSO SOLICITAN EL PRÉSTAMO PARA COMPRAR ROLLOS DE TELA POLAR. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Silvia and her husband Andres live in the Bajo Pampahasi zone which is located 30 minutes from the centre of the city. Silvia is a young hardworking woman who works making quilts and bedspreads from polar fleece. She began this activity thanks to her parents and siblings who do the same activity. Silvia makes various quilts and bedspreads and then sends them to the city of Bermejo. Andres has a minibus and provides public transport. He is affiliated with the group 'Leones', part of a transport syndicate 'Virgen de Fatima'. Each syndicate has various groups, that are made up of different members who are proprietors and wage-earners. This is the first time that Silvia and Andres are seeking a loan from this institution and they come recommended by other clients. Silvia and her husband are seeking a loan to purchase rolls of polar fleece. They are thankful for Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in granting them this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rolls of thread

loans.name: Irène

texts.fr: Née en 1964 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, K. Irène vit depuis trente ans à Ekpè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Irène est mariée à HOUNHOUENOU Christophe et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Irène vit à Ekpè avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. N'ayant jamais été à l'école, Irène mène comme activité la vente de bouillie de maïs, de façon ambulante. Irène achète ses matières premières à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Irène exerce cette activité depuis 16 ans et c'est la première fois qu'elle sollicite un prêt de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser son activité et de se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Born in 1964 in Cotonou , the economic capital of Bénin, Irène K. has lived for thirty years in Ekpè in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. She is married to Christophe HOUNHOUENOU and is mother to four children, all of whom are at school. Irène lives in Ekpè with her children and her husband. The couple shares responsiblity for supporting the family. Having never attended school, Irène has a business selling "bouillie" (a type of porridge) made from corn, on a door-to-door basis. She buys her basic products in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. She has been carrying out this activity for 16 years and it is the first time she has applied to ALIDé for a loan, which she wants in order to increase her business and make more money.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, sugar and firewood for making "bouillie".

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Justo tiene 32 años, es conviviente y tiene una hija de 2 años de edad. Tiene una 
mototaxi que maneja diariamente, la cual es la fuente de sus ingresos. Dicha moto la 
adquirió hace algunos años productos de sus ahorros. Requiere el crédito para realizar 
mantenimiento de su unidad vehicular. El es una persona amable y muy responsable al 
brindar sus servicios de trasnporte. Sus sueños y metas son sacar a su familia 
adelante brindandoles bienestar y educación.
texts.en:
Justo, 32, lives with his life partner and 2-year-old daughter. He has a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) that he drives daily; it is his only source of income. He bought the mototaxi a few years ago with some of his savings. He needs funds for vehicle maintenance and repair. His dreams and goals are to get his family ahead and to provide for their wellbeing and education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married with one child. He has greenhouses where he grows tomatoes and cucumbers. Oleg has been in this business for six years. He enjoys working on the land and providing people with high quality vegetables. He keeps his greenhouses and household in order. He fixes things himself when something breaks. Oleg's wife helps him in his business.
Oleg would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to equip his greenhouses. He needs to purchase some new cover film, water hoses, fertilizers, etc. He hopes to grow more vegetables this year and increase his family's income.

loans.use: To equip greenhouses with new cover film, water hoses, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: LUIS ES UN CLIENTE QUE CUENTA CON UN SALÓN DE BELLEZA,  TRABAJA EN EL MISMO LOCAL  HACE 06 AÑOS, ES SOLTERO NO CUENTA CON CARGA FAMILIAR VIVE EN CASA DE SUS PADRES, NO TRABAJA CON NINGUNA OTRA ENTIDAD FINANCIERA, SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA INCREMENTAR SUS PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA Y ASI AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO YA QUE POR EL BUEN TRABAJO QUE REALIZA  Y EL BUEN SERVICO QUE BRINDA SU CLIENTELA VIENE AUMENTANDO Y NECESITA MAYORES PRODUCTOS PARA PODER OFRECERLES Y PODERLES BRINDAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO, EN LA ZONA DONDE VIVE CUENTA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS, MUESTRA VOLUNTAD Y CAPACIDAD DE PAGO, POR LO QUE SE LE PROPONE EL PRESENTE CRÉDITO.
texts.en:
Luis has had a beauty salon for the past 6 years. He is single and has no children to support; he lives with his parents and does not receive help from any other financial institution. He is asking for funds to buy more beauty products and supplies in order to increase his business since the good quality of work and customer service he is known for has increased his customer base and he needs more products to provide them with proper services. He has good references from residents in his area; he shows capacity and willingness to repay. Therefore, the current loan is proposed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en:
Philomene is 46 years old and is married with five children who are between 2 and 18 years old. She also takes care of two dependents, 4 and 8 years old.

Philomene has been struggling by selling drinks she makes from sorghum and this is her eighth successful year in this business.

Although Philomene has an experience of eight years in this business, her earned profits are still too low to care for her children and dependents. She needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, she will purchase a large quantity of sorghum, which in turn will help to satisfy her customers by increasing the sales of her drinks.

If successful, Philomene will continue taking care of her children and her two dependents by providing more food and paying school fees for them.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of sorghum to make more drinks to sell

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 29 years old and married with one child.  Francoise is an entrepreneur selling a variety of foodstuffs.  Those foodstuffs include rice, sugar, different types of flour, cooking oil etc.  Francoise has been in this business for about two years.  Her shop is open from 6 am to 6 pm every day.

Francoise struggles to make a profit and believes that she is unable to satisfy her customer needs.  To end this, a small amount of additional capital would help her business grow in a meaningful way.  For that reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of additional goods that hopefully will satisfy the demand of her customers and increase her sales in the process.  If her notion to expand her products is successful, Francoise will be able to build her business and a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of additional goods, mainly foodstuffs

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 31 years old and married with two children who are 2 and 4 years old.  Seraphine is in the business of selling a variety of goods in her shop.  Those goods include cosmetic goods, radio batteries, soap, notebooks etc as the photo indicates.  The hours of the business are from 6 am to 7 pm every day.

Seraphine is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for expanding her shop by adding a large quantity of goods in her shop.  Those goods will mainly include foodstuffs like beans, rice, sugar, different types of flours etc.  With those goods, Seraphine will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to reinvest in her business so that her revenue can keep growing.  If successful, Seraphine will continue taking care of her children by providing more food for them as well as building a secure future for them.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like beans, rice, sugar, different types of flours etc to resell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La Señora Herminia S. G. tiene 36 años de edad, ella vive sola y sus 6 hijos los cuales son todos pequeños con edades de 15, 10, 8, 6, 4 y 2 años. Ellos viven en inmediaciones de Vilomilla en una zona agrícola de la Zona de Sipe-Sipe de la provincia de Quillacollo.

La Señora Herminia es una señora que se dedica a la agricultura,  y a la producción de leche cruda, la señora vive sola con sus hijos pues hace una año que su esposo la abandono, y desde entonces ella mantiene a su  numerosa familia. Herminia ordeña sus vacas todos los días a primeras horas y luego regresa su casa para alistar a sus hijos y llevarlos a su escuela, luego lleva a sus vacas a pastear, a entregar su leche para vender  y retorna a su casa para preparar el almuerzo para sus hijos; así todos los días tiene una actividad muy ardua. La señora Herminia es una señora que busca dar siempre una mejor vida a sus hijos, una mejor educación, salud y alimentación, todo lo que pueda en sus posibilidades darles, a pesar de que la vida fue muy dura con ellos desde que se fue su padre, los niños tienen sueños de estudiar y ayudar siempre a su mamá.

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero de ese modo poder aumentar la producción de leche, y así poder incrementar más sus ingresos y poder ofrecer a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Herminia S. G., 36, lives alone with her six young children, who are 15, 10, 8, 6, 4 and 2 years old. They live near Vilomilla in a farming sector of Sipe-Sipe, Quillacollo province. Herminia is a farmer and also raises dairy cattle for raw milk production. She lives alone with her children because her husband abandoned her a year ago. Since then, she supports her large family by herself. Herminia milks her cows daily early in the morning. She then returns home to get her children ready for school and takes them there. Next, she takes her cows out to pasture, delivers the milk for sale and returns home to prepare lunch for her children. Thus her daily routine is hard work. Herminia is always looking to provide her children with a better life, a better education, nutrition and health; everything that is within her grasp to give them, even though life for them has been very hard since their father left. The children hope to study and always help their mother. She is asking for funding to buy another cow so that milk production will increase thereby increasing income so that she can provide a better standard of living for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en: Mykola is married with one child. He and his wife Lesya have a business selling bicycles. Mykola loves this business because he himself loves to ride. (Their son who is three already has his own small bicycle.) Mykola would like to borrow 6,000 UAH to increase his bicycle inventory. His dream is to start a bicycle club in their small town to introduce more people to a healthy and fun activity.

loans.use: to increase his bicicyle inventory

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 47 years old. He has a wife and four children who are between 12 and 17 years old.  Alex is known in the business of selling drinks and he has been in this business for about 10 years.  The hours of his business are from 6 am to 10 pm every day.  

Although Alex has been in this business for a long, his capital is still too low as well as his profits.  To end this, Alex needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company, which in turn will allow him to increase the sales as well as the profits.  With these profits, Alex hopes to start saving as well as reinvesting in his business which hopefully will result in helping him to continue paying school fees for his children and building a secure future for them.

loans.use: To buy additional drinks to sell

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane is 29 years old and married, and she has two children, ages 2 and 4 years old. Diane is well-known in the food business. She sells food such as beans, rice, and Irish potatoes. This is her third successful year in this business. The hours of her business are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Saturday.

Diane struggles to make a profit and believes that she is unable to satisfy her customer needs. A small amount of additional capital would help her business to grow in a meaningful way. She is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of additional goods which, hopefully, will satisfy the demand of her customers and increase her sales. If her notion to expand her products is successful, Diane will be able to build her business and a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy food to sell

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso tiene 60 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el sector Pampa La Aviación del distrito de Chóchope, ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde que era muy joven, el posee un terreno propio de dos hectáreas en el que suele sembrar granos. Actualmente tiene instalado en ese terreno un cultivo de maíz desde hace quince dias. Con la cosecha de este producto el piensa obtener los recursos económicos para sacar a su familia adelante, por este motivo Alfonso pone todo su esfuerzo para sacarlo adelante.

Actualmente es tiempo de aplicarle fertilizantes y foliares a su cultivo para que este se desarrolle en las correctas condiciones que le permitan brindar una buena producción; por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo

Alfonso es un padre responsable y muy entregado a su familia, su mayor anhelo es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El es una persona conocida y respetada en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Alfonso, 60, lives with his family in the Pampa La Aviación sector of Chóchope district, located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a farmer since very young; he owns his own, two-hectare, field where he grows grains. He planted corn two weeks ago and hopes that the corn harvest will produce income to help the family get ahead. Alfonso, therefore, puts all his efforts into a successful harvest. This is the right time, then, to apply fertilizers and other nutrients to the crop so that it will develop under the right conditions for optimal production. He is, therefore, requesting a loan, for the first time, from Edpyme Alternativa. He needs 1500 new soles to reach his objective. Alfonso is a responsible father who is very dedicated to his family; his greatest wish is to provide them with a better quality of life. He is a known and respected person in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his corn crops.

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en:
Donathile is 52 years old and married. She has 13 children between the ages of 12 and 36 years old.  Donathile has been struggling; trying any business that might allow her to get money to care for her children. As an older businesswoman, Donathile is well-known in the business of making kindles (tiny gasoline-burning stoves), which she sells in her village.  

Donathile is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy a machine to solder many kindles, since as they are in high demand in her area. With this loan, Donathile will also start to sell the gasoline that is used in the kindles. In addition, she will continue find new ways to make her business more profitable which, in turn, will allow her to continue taking care of her business more than she could do previously.

loans.use: To buy a soldering machine

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 26 years old and married. She has two children, ages 1 and 5 years old.  Chantal is well-known as a proven entrepreneur. She sells cosmetics, mainly body lotion. This is her second year in this business, which is open from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day.

Chantal is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by adding more cosmetic products. Her neighborhood is the right place to sell cosmetics, because there are boarding schools in the area and many students who like to buy cosmetics. With this business expansion, Chantal will keep saving for further reinvestment in her business. Withbthis loan, Chantal has a hope of a better future.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: La Suerte Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Suerte esta conformados por tres mujeres que se han especializado en estilismo y estética en sus diferentes rubros.  Empezando por la coordinadora Sonia Claribel Basto quien vende cosméticos por catalogo. Ella inicio con el negocio cuando una promotora de la Avon le explico cómo funcionaba el negocio y la incentivo. 
Mientras Meyvi María Rugama Sevilla inicio con la comercialización de cosméticos del mercado pero al pasar del tiempo y por la demanda de sus clientes a  los productos  Avon decide afiliarse a esta marca. Además de vender joyería de oro y plata.

Por otra parte Lissette del Socorro Navarro quien estudio estilismo y belleza empezó trabajando en un salón donde realizaba manicure, pedicura, tintes, alisados y peinados de todo tipo lo que le permitió hacer clientela  e ir comprando su utilería  para luego instalar su propio salón de belleza.  Esto fue posible en el 2005 y desde entonces ha ido invirtiendo en el negocio.

Ellas invertirán en productos de belleza desde labiales, delineadores, rubor, pintura de uñas, cremas, productos de limpieza facial etc.
texts.en:
The “La Suerte” (Luck) group is made up of three women who are in various aspects of the beauty industry. First is the group coordinator, Sonia Claribel Basto, who sells catalogue cosmetics. She started out when an Avon representative explained to her how the business worked and motivated her. Meyvi María Rugama Sevilla started out selling cosmetics but, as time went by and her customers insisted on asking for Avon products, she decided to affiliate herself to that brand. She also sells gold and silver jewelry. Finally, Lissette del Socorro Navarro, who studied cosmetology, started out working in a beauty salon doing manicures, pedicures, hair coloring and straightening, and all styles of haircuts. This led to a regular customer base and made it possible for her to gradually purchase work tools and eventually set up her own salon in 2005. Since then, she has invested in this business. They will invest the funds in beauty products like: lipstick, eye shadow, blush, nail polish, creams, skin cleansing products, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Avon products.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 28 years, married with one child and one dependent.  Beatha is a self-employed businesswoman who owns a small shop selling a variety of goods such as cooking oil, baths, saucepans, plastic shoes, cosmetic products etc.  Beatha has been in this business for about three years and the hours of her business are from 6 am to 6 pm every day.

Beatha wants to expand her business through adding new goods like clothes and shoes.  Those additional goods will hopefully increase her revenue.  To this end, Beatha is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  If Beatha is successful in her business, she hopes that she will be able to attract more and different customers and increase her sales in the process.  With this business success, Beatha will continue to build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: New goods such as clothes and shoes for sale

loans.name: Denise

texts.en:
Denise is 32 years old, married, and has one child who is one year old.  Denise in the business of selling a variety of clothes, mainly women's clothes.  This is her tenth successful year in this business, which she starts from 10 am to 8 pm every day.

Denise is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through adding a variety of styles such as clothes for men as well as clothes for children.  With this additional business, Denise will hopefully earn more profits than her previous business.  From these profits, one portion will be used in building a secure future for her family ande the other portion will be used for further reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: Expand clothing store inventory

loans.name: Wilma Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora Wilma Franciasca tiene 33 años de edad ella vive en Cochabamba sola con sus 2 hijos pequeños, su esposo vive en Santa Cruz, Wilma vive en inmediaciones de Mallco Rancho, en la periferia de la ciudad, en una zona agrícola de la Zona de Sipe-Sipe de la provincia de Quillacollo.

Wilma es una señora que dedica a la producción de leche cruda, ella y su familia siempre están en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, por esa misma razón su esposo viajo hasta Santa Cruz para buscar trabajo y así desde ese departamento poder enviar dinero a su familia, a pesar de los esfuerzos que ambos esposos hacen, no pueden cubrir todas las necesidades que quisieran dar a sus hijos, pues viven en dos cuartitos rústicos fríos y de paredes de adobe, ella usa un fogón para cocinar con leña, y usa ollas de barro. Wilma tiene los deseos de comprarse un terreno peño donde poder dar cobijo y sustento a sus hijitos.   

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de soya para poder aumentar la producción de leche y la elaboración de quesillo y teniendo más ingresos podrá ofrecerle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
. Wilma Franciasca, 33, lives alone in Cochabamba with her two, small children; her husband lives in Santa Cruz. Wilma lives near Mallco Rancho, in the outskirts of the city, in a farming area of Sipe-Sipe, Quillacollo province. Wilma is a raw milk farmer; she and her family are always looking for ways to improve their quality of life. This is why her husband moved to Santa Cruz: to find work and send back money to the family from there. Despite the couple’s joint efforts, they are still unable to meet all household expenses and provide all they’d like for their children. They live in two, rudimentary, cold little rooms with adobe walls. She cooks in a hearth with firewood and uses clay pots. Wilma dreams with buying a small lot where she can provide shelter and sustenance for her wee ones. She is asking for funds to buy feed for her cows to increase milk production and to make quesillo (a cottage-cheese like product) so that income will increase and she can offer her family with an improved standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy cow feed.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is married, 60 years old and blessed with five children and many grandchildren. All of his children have done very well in both school and business. Paul lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. His wife is a businesswoman who also helps support their family while he makes a living selling medicines at retail prices. He has applied for a loan of N100,000 to buy more items to sell and offers his sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more medicines to sell to his customers

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 32 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Raymundo de 38 años y sus 4 hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Todos los días trabaja junto a su esposo en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra varios productos, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de muy buena calidad. Principalmente siembra papa y alverja, ya que estos productos se están vendiendo muy bien en el mercado.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Para el futuro, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un puesto de venta estable en el mercado, ya que actualmente vende de forma ambulatoria.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Martha con MFP, siente que este crédito la ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. A su vez, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Martha is 32 years old. She is a hardowrking and happy mother. She lives at home with her husband Raymundo who is 38 and her 4 children whom are the drive of her efforts.

Everyday she farms with her husband. With much work she has managed to develop productive land and now grows various products. She also knows all of her products will be of a good quality. They mainly grow potatoes and peas, since those products sell very well in the market. What she loves most about her job is protecting her crops from plagues that can harm them. She has been working in this job for 20 years and the most difficult part is transporting her products to the wholesale market in the city. For the future, she hopes to save up enough money to buy a stand in the market since currently she sells by foot.

This is Martha's seventh loan with MFP. She feels that this loan will help her develop her plans. In turn, she is proud to be a responsible member of her communal bank. The 3000 soles will be used to improve her crops by buying fertilizer and insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Marly María

texts.es:
Marly M. M., oriunda de San Jacinto, Bolívar, tiene 45 años y vive en el barrio Blas de Lezo de la ciudad de Cartagena. Está casada con 2 hijos de 13 y 7 años que están estudiando y que los ama con todo su corazón, es decir, son su razón de existir. Desde hace varios años tiene una sala de belleza y peluquería a las cuales adiciona la venta de mercancías que solicitan sus clientes en barrios de la ciudad. Este es su primer crédito lo solicita por un valor de $2.000.000, el cual quiere invertir tanto en adecuar su sala de belleza y comprar productos para este local, como jeans, sábanas, toallas, camisas de colegio, blusas y otros productos pedidos por sus clientes. Con este préstamo espera incrementar su clientela y seguir en un proceso, que ya empezó cuando abrió su local, de brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida para verlos felices y profesionales: lo que considera la mejor herencia que pueda dejarles. Es más tiene meta de tener una casa propia y espera algún día ser reconocida en la ciudad como una gran empresaria colombiana.
Sus dos negocios los tiene desde hace mucho tiempo ya que en el trabajo de su esposo en las paradas de Ecopetrol existen largos periodos de receso. A pesar de que él gane bien en el trabajo, en estas temporadas es preciso que los negocios de ella sostengan el hogar y en tales momentos él la ayuda en las ventas de mercancía y perfumería. Por la necesidad de ingresos familiares inició su negocio de una sala de belleza ya que arreglaba uñas desde muy joven y en esto vio una fuente de empleo, realizó cursos y poco a poco fue comprando sus implementos hasta montar su propia sala de belleza. Su clientela ha crecido bastante, pero la mayor cantidad de clientes le exigen más y es por estas exigencias que ahora recurre a un microcrédito de la Fundación, ya que el crédito no lo veía necesario hasta ahora. La señora Marly le da las gracias a Dios por su familia y por haberle dado la posibilidad de mejorar cada día el oficio a que se dedica con mucho amor y desde hace mucho tiempo; y con que ha podido brindar a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Marly M. M. is a native of San Jacinto, Bolívar. She is 45 years old and lives in the Blas de Lezo neighborhood in the city of Cartagena. She's married and has two children aged 13 and 7 who are students. She loves them with all her heart; that is to say, they are her reason for living. For the past several years, she has had a beauty and hairstyling salon where she also sells the types of merchandise her customers ask for in city neighborhoods. This is her first loan and she requests a loan of 2,000,000 COP. She would invest it in outfitting her beauty salon and in buying products for her store such as jeans, sheets, towels, school shirts, blouses and other products requested by her customers. With this loan, she hopes to increase her customer numbers and continue with the process. When she opened this location, she wanted to offer her children a better quality of life so she can see them be happy and be professional, which she considers the best inheritance she could leave them. She also hopes to own her own home and and one day be recognized in her city as a great Columbian businesswoman. She's had these two businesses for quite some time because her husband's job at Ecopetrol stops involves long periods of layoffs. Even though he earns a good living at this job, during certain times, her businesses are the ones that support the home. When that happens, he helps her sell the merchandise and perfume. She started the beauty salon because she needed income for the family. She's been doing nails since she was very young and she's always seen it as a source of employment. She took courses and little by little was able to buy her tools until she began her own beauty salon. Her customer base has grown significantly, but the majority of her customers demand more. Due to these demands, she's looking for a microloan from Fundación because up until now, she has not felt it to be necessary. Marly thanks god for her family and for having given her the chance to improve each day with her position which she's been doing for so long with so much love. This has also allowed her to offer her family a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Raquel Perez-Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Outfit her beauty salon and buy merchandise such as jeans, sheets, towels, school shirts and blouses

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
Nazario tiene 31 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y alegre. Vive en su casa propia y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro con tal de sobre salir en la vida.

Teniendo todavía una vida por delante, sabe que tiene que poner todas sus fuerzas para lograr ganarse la vida con su labor. Él se dedica a la siembra de papa, choclo y alverja, productos que llegada la época de cosecha lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde sus clientes (comerciantes), conocedores de la calidad de sus cultivos, los compran rápidamente.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas; lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el mercado donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Para más adelante, desea comprar más tierras con las cuales pueda aumentar su producción agrícola.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Nazario con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. Asimismo, en su banco comunal es un socio muy participativo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de papa y alverja, también abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Nazario is 31 years old. He is a very straightforward and cheerful man. He lives in his own house and is willing to work very hard with the aim of getting ahead in life. Still having a lifetime ahead of him, he knows that he has to put all of his effort into earning a steady living through his labor. He works growing potatoes, corn and peas, and when harvest time comes, he takes them to sell in the city's wholesale market. His clients (merchants) are familiar with the quality of his crops, and so they buy them up quickly. What he likes most about his work is protecting his fields from pests. He has worked in farming for 10 years, and he thinks the hardest part is taking his products to the market where he sells them, since the sacks he carries are very heavy. For the future, he would like to buy more land in order to increase his agricultural production. This is Nazario's eighth loan with MFP, and he knows that he needs to make his payments punctually if he wants to have access to another loan later. He is a very active participant in his communal bank. With the two thousand Peruvian new soles he is requesting, he will buy potato and pea seeds, as well as fertilizer and insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 28 years old, married with two children as well as two dependents that are between 2 and 18 years old.  Jeanne is in the business of selling new clothes, mainly men's shirts.  The hours of her business are from 8 am to 8 pm every day. 

Jeanne is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business by adding a variety of products such as jeans and women's clothes.  With this business expansion, Jeanne will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn, will allow her to build a secure future for her children and keep her business sustainable.

loans.use: Adding new varieties of clothing to store inventory

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 31 years old, single, and takes care of two dependents.  Eric has been in the business of selling charcoal for about 1 year but his original investment as well the profits earned from his business are still too low.  

Eric plans to set up another warehouse containing a large number of sacks of charcoal for sale.  He is therefore requesting a Kiva loan, which he hopes will allow increasing his sales as well as his profits.  With these profits, he will sustain his business and in addition will start building his own house.

loans.use: Buying charcoal in bulk for resale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. O. is a forty-eight-year-old woman married to Mr. Samuel Jowi, who has a motorcycle transport business. They have four children aged between 18 and 10. They live in Katito, an upcoming town in Western Kenya. To make a living, Florence makes and sells doughnuts (locally known as mandazi) at Katito shopping center. The doughnut is a popular breakfast snack taken with tea. Her day starts early due to the high demand for the snack in the morning. Her target market includes people going to work and school-going children who are early risers. 

Florence is taking out a third loan from KADET Ltd having fully serviced a previous loan without difficulties. She intends to buy baking flour and cooking oil. Her business is growing because the mandazi are preferred over bread. This is confirmed by the great number of customers, mostly women, flocking to her stall to buy hot snacks for breakfast. The preparation of the doughnuts has become Florence's largest source of income and she hopes to use her profits to pay her children's school fees. She feels that this is the best thing she can offer them as a parent.

loans.use: To buy baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adan tiene 33 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el caserío El Pueblito, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi. El empezó a desarrollarse en esta actividad alquilando unidades para trabajar y luego, con los ahorros de su trabajo, puedo comprar la propia, actualmente se vale de ella para brindar sus servicios tanto en la ciudad Olmos como en los caseríos aledaños.

El continuo uso brindado a su unidad movil y el estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona han hecho que su mototaxi empiece a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por ese motivo Adan se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi.

El es una persona responsable y que dia a dia da lo mejor de si para lograr el bienestar de los suyos. Su sueño es seguir creciendo como empresario de transporte y hacerse conocido en el medio.
texts.en:
Adan is 33 years old and lives together with his family in the farming community El Pueblito, a rural zone of the Olmos district, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past five years, he has worked transporting goods and passengers on a moto-taxi. He started in this field by renting vehicles to use, and later, with the savings from his work, he was able to buy his own vehicle. Currently, he uses his moto-taxi to provide his services in the city of Olmos as well as in outlying villages. The constant use of his vehicle and the rough condition of the area's roads have caused his moto-taxi to begin to suffer some mechanical damage. Repairs are urgently needed so that his vehicle will operate properly. For this reason, Adan has come to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time, requesting a loan of 1000 Peruvian new soles, which he plans to invest in the repair and maintenance of his moto-taxi. Adan is a responsible person who does his best each day to provide for the well-being of his loved ones. His dream is to continue growing as a transportation entrepreneur and become well-known in his field.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing and maintaining his vehicle

loans.name: Sidikat

texts.en:
Sidikat makes a living selling palm and groundnut oil in gallon cans to her customers. She travels far from Lagos to buy her goods and has been in business for 11 years. She is 32 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 2 and 14. Her husband is a mechanic and is doing well in his business. 

The last Kiva loan Sidikat received really improved her business and family's living standards. She hopes to continue growing her small company, and has applied for a loan of NGN 50,000 to buy more groundnut and palm oil to sell. She offers sincere thanks to all Kiva lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: To buy more groundnut and palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo is married with four children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. She is a 50-year-old hardworking woman who sells for long hours to support her home. To make a living, she fries fish to sell. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. 

Iyabo is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more fish to fry and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Ndanu

texts.en:
Ndanu is 40 years old, married to James Mwangi, and they have a four-year-old child who attends nursery school. Ndanu has been cooking on the road side for four years and her food, which includes potato fries, is very popular with the construction workers. Naivasha is an upcoming town with many residential and commercial buildings being built, so she sees a steady stream of customers for her business.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to buy three sacks of potatoes. Her plan for the future is to open a hotel and move to a more permanent place to operate from.

loans.use: To buy 3 sacks of potatoes

loans.name: C5210 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Theogene is 33 years and he is still single.  Theogene takes care of one relative who is 8 years old.  Theogene is the president of a group called Tuzamurane.  This group is commonly in the business of selling goods in their shop.  The business hours are from 6 am until late in the evening hours.

Theogene and his team are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business through adding a large quantity of items customers need, such as: beans, maize, sorghum, rice, and sugar.  With this additional business, this group will even start wholesaling to the retailers to increase their revenue.  Once successful, each member of the team has a hope of a better future.

loans.use: Expanding store inventory

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 28 years old and married to Monicah Wairimu. He opened his retail shop in Naivasha town last year and it has proved to be a profitable venture.  

He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to add stock by buying cooking fat, maize flour and rice in bulk.

He plans to grow in the retail sector and open a mini-supermarket.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, maize and rice in bulk to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells sarongs to make a living; she hawks from street to street and from community to community. She is very happy with her business. She is planning to open her own shop so that she can stop hawking. She has been in the business for the past 13 years; with it, she helps her husband who works as a civil servant.
 
Mary, 42 years old, is married with three children and they live in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more sarongs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, 36 years old, sells bread and Semovita. She does her business from home and has been in the business for over 10 years. She makes good profit and she hopes for more business growth in future so she can save and reinvest into her business. Caroline is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more bread and Semovita to sell. She promises to repay her loan.

Caroline’s husband is a commercial motorcycle rider in Lagos and they are blessed with four children. Caroline is very optimistic about the prosperity of her business and of her family. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more bread and Semovita to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rent a tractor to plough his field

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice travels to Edo State to buy yams and bags of gari (manioc grits) and transports them to Lagos State to sell. She has been in this business for the past 11 years and she is very happy with the nature of her business. She wants to open another shop close to the market so that she can increase her productivity and profitability.

She is married with 3 children and her husband is a businessman. She is 40 years of age and she's very determined to improve the family living standard. She hopes for the loan of NGN 160,000 to purchase more yams and gari in a large quantity to sell. This will reduce the cost of travelling far always to purchase inventory and will increase her profit. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and gari to sell

loans.name: C2577 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Pelagie is 32 years old and married. She has two children, ages 5 and 7. Pelagie's husband is a farmer, but his farm is not profitable, so Pelagie has decided to be a businesswoman for her family's profit.
