Pelagie is group representative of the Abizeranye Group. Pelage runs a general store and has four years of experience in her business. Her shop is open  from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day, even during the weekend.

Pelagie and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand their business. This loan will be important for them simply because their expansion will attract more customers to their business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace W. G. is forty years old and the mother of a son aged ten years. She sells clothes and handbags at Mwembe Tayari market in Mombasa. She has been doing this business for ten years. She says the business is good and the only challenge is that rent is very expensive and security is also compromised as the premises are shared. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes to grow her business. She hopes to work hard to open her own boutique. She is a very hard-working lady.

loans.use: Clothes

loans.name: Nyameke

texts.en:
Nyameke B. sells fresh plantains in Jukwa. Nyameke has received a junior-high education. She is divorced and stays with her two children. 

Nyameke has been selling plantains for quite some time now. She is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills. Her loan will enable her go to the farmers to buy and transport the foodstuffs herself instead of buying them on a retail basis. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her two children.

loans.use: To buy and transport plaintains directly from farms

loans.name: Fegbawè

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée, elle n’a pas d’enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2007.  Sa clientèle grandit tout les jours, son stock actuelle  ne lui permet pas de satisfaire tous ses clients. Voulant gonfler son stock, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 4 cartons de lait concentré, 3 cartons de sardines, 4 bidons d’huile, 3 cartons de savons
texts.en:
This lady is married but does not have any children. She has an income-generating activity selling general grocery porducts and has been carrying out this activity since 2007. Her customer base is growing from day to day and her current stock is insufficient to satisfy customer demand. In order to boost her stock, she is applying to WAGES for a loan in order to buy four cartons of concentrated milk, three cartons of sardines, four cans of oil and three cartons of soaps.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general grocery products

loans.name: Kossi Richard

texts.en:
Kossi Richard A. is 44 years old. He is married, has two children and lives in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo. Mr. A. runs a grocery store. He sells a variety of staple products as well as a local alcohol called sodabi. 

He began this business two years ago and is currently requesting his first loan from WAGES, a Kiva partner. He will use this loan to purchase four boxes of condensed milk, five sacks of sugar and six barrels of cooking oil. By keeping his shelves stocked, Mr. A. will be prepared for the ongoing demand of his customers.

loans.use: Purchase of condensed milk, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Luciana Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal LUCIANA, en su Secuencia 2, está formado por 10 clientes, todas mujeres, la mayoría D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. San Antonio, y algunas socias que viven en la zona  D. Villa Copacabana, las socias se dedican a la venta D. cosméticos, venta D. comida, atención D. eventos infantiles, tratamientos D. belleza. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron bien. También se lamento el fallecimiento D. una socia en el transcurso del ciclo. 

La Sra. Carmen Es la representante, actualmente toma el cargo D. la presidenta del banco, en cuanto a su actividad ella es Medico Fisioterapeuta, realiza trabajos a domicilios y en consultorios con médicos asociados realiza esta actividad hace 5 años, también se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos. El préstamo será destinado a la compra D. aparatos D. medicina.  Soltera sin hijos vive D. alquiler con sus familiares. En su banco comunal, ella se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

la Sra. Pamela Socia que asume el cargo D. tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta D. ropa y cosméticos en diferentes lugares ya sea en instituciones  se dedica a esta actividad hace 2 años, el préstamo esta destinado a la inversión D. capital. Soltera sin hijos, vive en alquiler con sus padres y sus hermanos.
Ha sido elegida para el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado dentro del banco como garante y como compañera D. grupo.
 
La Sra. Soledad, Ha sido elegida como secretaria , se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. diferentes Empresas, también es procuradora (tramitadora). El préstamo esta destinado para la inversión D. capital en cosméticos.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y dinamicas y estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The LUCIANA communal bank is in its second loan cycle; it’s maD. up of 10 members, all women, who are neighbors in the San Antonio neighborhood (some live in Villa Copacabana). Some members sell cosmetics, others prepared meals, some are children’s party planners, others are beauticians. They repaid their previous loan on time. This cycle also included mourning for one of the members who died during this cycle. Carmen is the group representative and bank president. She is a medical therapist providing services both in customers’ homes and in clinics she’s associated with; she has been in this line of work for 5 years. She also sells cosmetics. She is single, has no children and rents with her relatives. She is responsible and punctual with her repayments. She will use the loan to buy medical equipment. Pamela is group treasurer. She sells clothing and cosmetics in various places like institutions; she has been in this line of work for 2 years. She is single and has no children; she rents with her parents and siblings. She was elected to this post because of the responsibility she has shown in the communal bank as guarantor and as a group member. She will use the funds to buy stock merchandise. Soledad is group secretary. She sells different brands of cosmetics and is also an expeditor. She will use the funds to buy cosmetics. All the group members are responsible, dynamic people who are very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena T. cooks banku (a Ghanaian delicacy made from corn dough, often served hot with soup) for sale in Jukwa. She is married and blessed with four wonderful children. Her husband is a mason. She assists her husband in taking care of the home. 

Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize for the making of the banku and other source ingredients. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to build a house. 

This picture of Abena was taken when some of her customers had come to eat.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize for the making of banku

loans.name: Pélagie

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Grand-Popo au Bénin, K. Pélagie vit à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Pélagie est mariée à MONTCHO Jean-Marc, un agent au port, avec qui elle a quatre enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Pélagie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges familiales. Pour participer aux dépenses de la famille, Pélagie exerce comme activité la vente de poissons fumés et frais de manière ambulante. C’est au port de pêche que Pélagie fait ses provisions. Pélagie n’a jamais fréquenté mais a déjà 15 années d’expériences dans son domaine. Deux crédits ont déjà été accordés à Pélagie par ALIDé, crédit qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Dans l’optique de vendre ses poissons en gros, Pélagie sollicite un troisième prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Grand-Popo in Benin, Pélagie K. lives in the Fiegnon area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin . She is married to Jean-Marc MONTCHO, a portuary agent, with whom she has had four children, some of them attending school. Pélagie lives with her husband and children. The couple jointly shares family expenses, and Pélagie participates by selling fresh and smoked fish as an itinerant vendor. She gets her supplies from the fishing port. Pélagie has never attended school, but has accumulated 15 years’ experience in her business. She has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, both of which have been repaid in full. She is now requesting a third loan, as she wants to start selling her fish wholesale.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy M. M. is a business lady from Gatundu in Kenya. She does tailoring and sells clothes to the local people. Her business is located near the Gatundu post office. She has been in this business for five years and has managed to employ two people. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more materials to grow her business. She hopes to make clothes in large quantities and sell them to increase her profits. Lucy is married and has three children. She is hard-working and self-motivated.

loans.use: buying more materials for tailoring

loans.name: Franca

texts.en:
Franca sells dried fish and potatoes in her shop in one of the markets in Lagos. She is well-known in the market even with the short time she has been working there. This is due to her good customer relations. Franca has been in the business for 2 years and she is doing very well.
 
Franca is married with 5 children and she is 37 years of age. She lives in Lagos with her family. She is very energetic and business-oriented, and she wants to improve the living standard of her family by sending the children to good schools, feeding, and more. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to buy more dried fish and potatoes to sell. She has been a member in LAPO microfinance for some years now with a good repayment record. She appreciates LAPO microfinance and Kiva for this wonderful initiative.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Ablavi Justine

texts.fr: Née en 1960 à Grand-Popo, au Bénin, Ablavi Justine H.  vit depuis environs 20 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Ablavi Justine est mariée et mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Ablavi Justine a un cinquième enfant à sa charge. Ablavi Justine vit seule avec ses enfants et subvient également seule à tous leurs besoins. Pour assurer une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants, Ablavi Justine exerce comme activité principale la vente de maïs et de manière secondaire, la vente de farine de manioc de façon ambulante. C’est à Ouègbo, au Bénin, que Ablavi Justine s’approvisionne. Ablavi Justine n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais exerce cette activité depuis 11 ans. En tant que cliente fidèle de ALIDé, Ablavi Justine a déjà obetnu deux crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Dans le but de fructifier ses revenus afin de s’acheter une parcelle, Ablavi Justine sollicite un troisième prêt chez ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Grand-Popo in Benin, Ablavi Justine H. has been living for the past 20 years in the Fiegnon area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin . She is married and is the mother of four children, all having attended (or still attending) school. She also has a fifth child to care for. She lives alone with her children and is their sole support for all their needs. To ensure her children receive a good education, Ablavi Justine is an itinerant vendor who sells corn as her main activity and cassava flour as her secondary activity. She gets her supplies from Ouegbo in Benin. She has not attended school, but has been in this line of business for the past 11 years. She is a regular client of ALIDé, and has already been granted two loans, both of which were repaid in full. Wishing to increase her earnings so she can purchase a plot of land, she is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn flour and cassave flour

loans.name: Taye

texts.en:
Taye lives in Lagos with her family, and she sells foodstuffs like fresh tomatoes and peppers. She has been in the business for over 5 years. She is very happy with the growing nature of her business and she wishes that her business would grow higher and higher. 

Taye is married with 4 children and she is 33 years of age. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs (tomatoes and peppers) to sell. Her plan is to continually support her husband in sponsoring her children’s education. She expresses her huge thanks to all lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs (tomatoes and peppers) to sell.

loans.name: Zaléya

texts.en:
Zaléya O. is 33 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as an automobile painter and they live in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo. 

Mrs. O. is a traveling saleswoman. She roams the Agoé neighborhood, balancing fabrics and jewelry on her head, and sells her products to passing customers. She began this business in 2000 and is now asking for her first loan from WAGES, a Kiva partner. She will use this loan to purchase a variety of chains, watches and brand-name fabrics to sell to her customers. This loan will help Mrs. O. keep her customers satisfied and will inevitably help with her family’s living expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry and fabrics for resale

loans.name: Pampahasi 2 Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal PAMPAHASI 2 está conformado por 9 clientes, todas mujeres, que están ubicados por los alrededores D. la oficina Emprender y por Alto Pampahasi subiendo por SAMAPA,. se dedican a la venta D. comida, venta D. verduras, cosméticos, elaboración y venta D. salteñas ventas en abarrotes y otros, pese a tener actividades muy distintas se conocen muy bien entre sí asistieron a todas las charlas y escucharon con atención porque la mayoría ingreso por primera vez a un banco comunal.

La Sra. Nely Representa a su banco en  el cargo D. Presidenta del banco se dedica a la confecccion D. todo tipo D. ropa, segun pedido D. los clientes, cuenta con esta actividad hace 10 años, el préstamo será destinado a la compra D. insumos (tela por rollo, esponja, algodón, store). Vive en la zona Escobar Uría con sus familiares, no tiene esposo pero tiene una hija producto D. una relación espontánea.
Ha sido elegida por su gran capacidad D. manejo D. personas y D. conocer a todas sus compañeras, responsable y dinámica desD. el inicio en las capacitaciones brindando su apoyo a todas sus compañeras coordinando en la conformación del banco 

La Sra. Eliza,  Socia que asume el cargo D. Tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta D. comida y refrescos  a pedidos para las instituciones públicas y privadas se dedica a esta actividad hace 5 años en su propio domicilio el préstamo esta destinado a la compra D. víveres por mayor  para sus pedidos. 

La Sra. July, Ha sido elegido como Secretaria, por su desenvolvimiento en la redacción, dinámica para la redacción y coordinación, se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos por mayor también realiza viajes a Cochabamba y a Santa cruz el préstamo esta destinado para la compra D. productos D. belleza que se encuentran en promosion, tiene dos hijos menores D. 12 años y ella sola mantiene el hogar.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Pampahasi 2 Communal Bank is maD. up of nine customers, all women, who live near the Emprender office in Alto Pampahasi just past the SAMAPA water company. They work in food sales, vegetable sales, cosmetics, preparation and sale of salteñas (Bolivian empanadas), grocery sales and other businesses. Despite their very different business activities, the members know each other very well. They attended all the training talks and listened attentively because the majority of them were becoming members of a communal bank for the first time. Nely is the president of the bank. She works making all types of clothes to fill customers' orders. She has been doing this for ten years. The loan will be used to purchase supplies (rolls of fabric, sponges, cotton, etc.). She lives in the Escobar Uría zone with her relatives. She is not married but has a daughter from a previous relationship. She has been chosen as president for her great ability to manage people and her knowledge and understanding of her companions. She has been responsible and dynamic since the beginning, lending her support to all her companions during the formation of the bank. Eliza, the treasurer of the bank, sells food and drinks on order to public and private institutions. She has been doing this for five years in her own home. The loan will be used to buy foods wholesale for her orders. July has been chosen as secretary because of her writing ability. She sells cosmetics wholesale and also makes trips to Cochabamba and Santa Cruz. The loan will be used to purchase beauty products on sale. She has two children under the age of 12, and she supports the family alone. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in them with the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon in Jukwa. She is married and her husband is a farmer. Her education is up to the senior high level.  

Abena uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their home. 

Abena will use the loan to purchase more hair products for sale and also for use at her beauty salon. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to save to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more hair products for sale and also for use at her beauty salon

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA CAROLINA ES SOLTERA  LLEVA MAS DE 6 AÑOS EN EL OFICIO DE VENTA DE COMIDA EN SU DOMICILIO EN LA CUAL LA SEÑORA ES BASTANTE CONOCIDA POR LA ESQUISITES DE SUS PLATOS QUE PREPARA, ELLA EMPEZO COMO AYUDANTE DE COCINA, CON UNA DE SUS TIAS QUE TENIA UNA PENSION, ELLA TRABAJO BASTANTE AHORRANDOSE DINERO PARA ASI PODER TENER SU PROPIA PENSION. ELLA VIVE CON SU HERMANO QUE ESTA ESTUDIANDO EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS MESA Y SILLAS  Y ASI PODER POTER TENER MAS INGRESOS Y MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE ELLA Y DE SU HERMANO. UNO DE SUS DESEOS ES DE CONTINUAR ESTUDIANDO Y SALIR PROFESIONAL ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA Y ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Carolina is single and has sold food in her house for over 6 years. She is quite well known thanks to her tasty preparations. She started out as a kitchen helper with an aunt, who had an eatery; she worked hard and saved money to have her own business. She lives with her brother, who is a university student The funds will be used to buy tables and chairs so that she can increase her earnings thus providing a better quality of life for herself and her brother. One of her wishes is to continue her own schooling and have a profession. She is very hard-working and very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
A 44 ans, cette femme a encore beaucoup d’énergie pour travailler afin de contribuer aux charges de sa famille. Elle exerce comme activité le commerce d’oignons et de gingembre. Elle veut dynamiser son stock. Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES deux crédits qu’elle a remboursé sans problème, ce troisième crédit lui permettra de gonfler son stock avec 4 paniers d’oignons, 3 paniers de gingembre et divers articles de mercerie.
Elle a 2 personnes à sa charge.
texts.en:
At 44 years of age, this lady expends great energy in her work to help manage family expenses. She is a retailer of onions and ginger, and she wants to bolster her business. She was already granted two loans from WAGES that she reimbursed without problems. This third loan will allow her to increase her stock of supplies with 4 baskets of onions, 3 baskets of ginger and various haberdashery items. She has two persons to care for.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy onions and ginger

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua E. makes and sells palm oil in Jukwa. Efua has a senior high school education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She assists her husband in taking care of the family. 

Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to make palm oil to sell. She hopes to save the new earnings from her business to buy a shop in the market place where she can keep and sell her oil.

loans.use: To buy palm fruits to make palm oil to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es una trabajadora mujer de 47 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus dos hijas. 
Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de diversos artículos para el hogar, todo lo novedoso que pueda encontrar, puesto que esta característica es la ventaja que tiene sobre las demás vendedoras. Vilma viaja durante casi 3 horas hasta el centro de la ciudad para visitar uno de los mercados más grandes y con mayor cantidad de productos para adquirir su mercadería. Es así que se abastece de lo más variado y de buena calidad que pueda encontrar y posteriormente lo vende en un puesto que tiene en la cuadra de la zona donde vive. Le va muy bien porque además de su mercadería, su facilidad de palabra y su gran poder de convencimiento han hecho de ella una gran vendedora, lo cual la tiene muy contenta con su trabajo. En un futuro, espera tener una tienda en su casa o en algún mercado donde pueda exhibir mejor sus artículos.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido una persona muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita planea comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para la época escolar, es que cuando sabe, obtendrá mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Vilma is a hard-working, 47 year old woman. She lives with her two daughters in her own house. For eight years she has been selling various household items. She sells everything new that she can find. This is the trait that gives her the advantage over the other sellers. Vilma travels almost three hours to the center of the city to visit one of the largest markets in order to get her merchandise. That is how she stocks up on the biggest variety and the best quality she can find. She previously sold from a stand she had on a block in the area where she lives. It is going very well for her because in addition to her merchandise, her ability with words and her great power to persuade have made her a great saleswoman. That makes her very happy with her work. In the future she hopes to have a store in her house or in a market where she can better display her items. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual with all of her payments. She will use the money she is now requesting to buy a greater quantity of merchandise for the school season. That is when she will have greater sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en: Kossi S. is a trained teacher. He lives with his wife in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo. Mr. S. now works selling gravel, a business he began in 2000. This will be his first loan from WAGES which he will use to purchase more gravel to add to his supply. This loan will ensure that Mr. S.’s business continues to be prosperous. He will also be able to continue to contribute to his family’s living expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of gravel for resale

loans.name: Nimatou

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de cola. Elle a démarré ce commerce en 2008 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Faisant face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter 40 sacs de cola.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, le revenu de son commerce lui permet de contribuer aux dépenses du foyer.
texts.en:
This lady retails cola nuts as her revenue-generating activity. She began business in 2008 and gets her supplies from the main market in Lomé. Confronted with a depletion of her stock of merchandise, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 40 bags of cola nuts. She is married and mother of two children. With the income generated by her business she can participate in managing household expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cola nuts

loans.name: Ruth Marina

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Marina C. M., tiene 47 años de edad vive en el Barrio Camilo Chamorro, es madre soltera de 4 hijos los dos mayores, son independientes y los otros actualmente estudian la primaria, ella trabaja como supervisora de ventas en un conocido supermercado.

El solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, con el propósito de realizar una división en su casa, que le ofrezca mejores comodidades para la familia y la privacidad necesaria para habitar en una espacio de respeto a su persona, espera se le brinde un apoyo económico, debido a que ella es una mujer sola que todos estos años ha librado una lucha constante, para mantener a sus hijos en una ambiente digno dentro de sus limitantes económicas.
texts.en:
Ruth Marina C. M., 47, lives in the Camilo Chamorro neighborhood; she is a single mother of 4 children, two adults and two in elementary school. She is a sales supervisor at a well-known supermarket. She is asking for funds to buy building materials to build interior walls in her house that will provide increased privacy and comfort for her family. She hopes the loan will be approved because she is a woman alone who has struggled constantly all these years to support her children in a proper home within her limited economic capacity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme est un célibataire, il vit dans le quartier d’agoè demakpoè qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, pour subvenir à ses besoins, il s’est lancée en 2008 dans le commerce de charbons de bois, afin d’augmenter ses recettes plus tard, il y a associé le commerce de céréales. Il s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de Kpalimé. La demande de sa clientèle est de plus en plus forte, pour pouvoir mieux les satisfaire, il doit augmenter son stock de marchandises. Pour réaliser cela il demande à WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter 35 sacs de charbons de bois, 23 sacs de maïs et assurer le transport.
texts.en:
This young man is unmarried. He lives in the Agoè Demakpoè borough, which is on the outskirts of Lomé. To meet his needs, he started a business in 2008 retailing charcoal. Later, to increase his earnings, he also started retailing cereals. He gets his supplies from the country’s interior in Kpalimé. Customer demand is increasing, so he must expand his stock supply to satisfy customer needs. He is therefore requesting a first loan from WAGES to buy 35 bags of charcoal, 23 bags of corn and ensure transportation of the merchandise.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy charcoal

loans.name: Santos Mauricio

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, el señor Santos P. se dedica a la venta de calzados tanto para damas como caballeros ofreciéndolos a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana en su localidad.

Actualmente está buscando la manera de mejorar las condiciones del negocio y está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de dichos calzados para continuar ofertándolos y así mejorar las condiciones del negocio.
texts.en:
Santos P. sells women's and men's shoes in Managua's Mayoreo market every day from very early in the morning on. He is currently looking for a way to improve the condition of his business so he's requesting funds to buy shoes so that he can continue to offer them for sale thus improving his business' condition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Ya Yeabu

texts.en:
Ya Yeabu K. is married and has one child.  She is a trader and used to sell assorted slippers. As her income increased, she moved from the sale of slippers to other consumer goods such as plastic bowls and dishes.  Ya Yeabu has seven years experience in business. 

Knowing well that her current business is progressive, Ya Yeabu felt it necessary to ask for a loan in order to buy more stock and generate more income in order to assist her child's education.   She plans as well to someday buy a piece of land and construct a dwelling house for her family.  She is very hard working and dedicated to her business.

loans.use: To buy plastic bowls and dishes.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Cette femme a appris le métier de la couture, mais n’ayant pas trouvé de moyen pour ouvrir son propre atelier, elle s’est lancée en 2000 dans le commerce des articles de mercerie. Sa clientèle  se compose de toutes personnes. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, son stock est en baisse. Pour se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES pour la deuxième fois un crédit pour l’achat de popeline, de satins et de mousselins.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè demakpoe à Lomé.
texts.en:
This is a woman who learned how to sew as a trade. But not being able to afford her own workshop, she got started in sewing supplies business in 2000.  Her customer base is compose of any and all people.  She gets her supplies from the big market Lomé.  Having a low inventory and wanting to replenish it, she is requesting a loan from WAGES for a second time in order to buy some poplins, satins, and muslins.   She is married and the mother of one child.  She lives with her family in the Agoè Demakpoe district in Lomé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying poplin, satin, and muslin cloths

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa K. is married and has four children. She started her business from money she received from her eldest daughter.  She started trading cotton and poplin materials.  As her income continued to increase, she expanded by purchasing more items.  Hawa K. continues to sell the same type of goods.  

She can now boast of having farm land which she acquired as a result of her business.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan to expand her stock and generate more income.  She intends to increase the size of her farm land, travel to neighbouring countries to buy stock and build a dwelling house for her family.  She is honest and dedicated to her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles.

loans.name: Mariela Jesenia

texts.es:
Mariela O. de 24 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico.  Es madre soltera tiene una niña de 5 años. Ella trabaja haciendo manualidades con fomix, su hermana le ayuda porque tiene tantos pedidos de empresas que necesita de alguien a su lado. 

Ella nunca se imagino trabajar a un volumen empresarial pero gracias al empuje que le dio ser madre soltera y tener que mantener a su hijo tuvo que buscar una actividad acorde a lo que ella sabía. Ella trabaja repartiendo sus manualidades a empresas del centro de Guayaquil. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar fomix para hacer más manualidades y comprar unos víveres para poner una pequeña tienda. En el futuro quiere un negocio más grande y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
Mariela O. is 24 years old. She lives in the outskirts of the city in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of concrete, and she only has electricity and water as basic services. She is the single mother of her five year old daughter. She works making handicrafts from foam. Her sister helps because she has so many company orders that she needs someone to help her. She never imagined that she would work with a volume for companies. But, thanks to the push being a single mother gave her and having to support her child, she had to look for an activity that she knew. She works delivering her handicrafts to companies in the center of Guayaquil. She wants to buy foam with the loan in order to make more handicrafts. She will also buy some supplies to set up a small store. In the future she wants to have a bigger business and to enjoy good health.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy foam for making handicrafts

loans.name: Rutilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Rutilda tiene 24 años vive en casa propia y se encuentra casada con el Sr. David quien es electricista, con el que tiene 3 hijos, doña rutilda tiene como actividad la venta y produccion de verduras, choclo y durazno, estos productos los siembra y trae de su pueblo cada quince dias y lo vende en el mercado Rodriguez a clientes antiguos y al por mayor tiene ya varios pedidos.

El crédito solicitado está dirigido a la compra de abono y semillas para la siembra de lechuga, ya que tiene pensado cosechar para el mes de junio.

La Sra. Rutilda es una persona responsable, dinamica y muy trabajadora que esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Rutilda, 24, lives in her own house; she’s married to David, who is an electrician, and they have three children. Rutilda is a peach and potato farmer and merchant. She grows these products and brings them from her town every two weeks to sell in the Rodriguez market to long-standing customers at wholesale; she already has several pending orders. She will use the requested funds to buy manure and lettuce seed that she plans to harvest in June. Rutilda is a responsible, dynamic, very hard-working person who is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and lettuce seed.

loans.name: Cleotilde Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora Cleotilde G. se ha destacado como excelente comerciante desde hace 25 años vendiendo diferentes frutas y en especial deliciosas papayas que son ofertadas por ella misma en su localidad.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de las papayas para continuar con la venta y de esta manera obtener los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Clotilde G. has stood out as an excellent merchant for over 25 years selling assorted fruits, especially papayas, in Managua's Mayoreo market; she tends to her stall herself. She is requesting funds to buy papayas in order to continue selling them thus earning income to support her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy papayas.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: Abibatu K. is married with three school going children.  Her business is located at the centre of a township called Campbell Street.  She used money from her husband to start a business of selling used clothing. As her income increased, she switched from selling used clothing to selling waxed and dry cotton wholesale.  Knowing well that the cotton business is more productive, Abibatu K. secured a group loan in order to increase her stock and she earned a good credit history.  She is now seeking an individual loan to buy more stock.  She has eight years of business experience and hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to pay her children's school fees and buy land.  She is hard working and honest.

loans.use: To buy textiles.

loans.name: Marcos Herminio

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, el señor Marcos R. se dedica a la venta de gafas tanto para damas y caballeros y también a la venta de relojes siendo comercializados ambulantemente en las calles del mercado buscando el capital económico para el sustento de su hogar.

Actualmente ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de las gafas y los relojes para darle continuidad a la venta que le es de mucha necesidad.
texts.en:
Marcos R. sells eyeglasses for men and women and wristwatches throughout the Mayoreo market's aisles in an effort to earn income to suupport his family. He is asking for funding to buy eyeglasses and wristwatches in order to continue with is sales, which are very necessary for him.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eyeglasses and wristwatches.

loans.name: Gustavo Antonio

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, el señor Gustavo C. se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado Mayoreo iniciando sus ventas desde las cinco de la mañana. 

Actualmente tiene la necesidad de comprar las verduras especialmente las chiltomas, papas, cebollas y chile para continuar ofertándolas y por esta razón es que ha solicitado un crédito para así continuar en la actividad supliendo las necesidades de sus clentes.
texts.en:
Gustavo C., with much effort and dedication, sells vegetables in the Mayoreo market; he opens for business at 5am. He needs to buy vegetables especially, peppers, potatoes, onions and chilies in order to continue with his sales. This is why he's asking for funds so that he can continue to supply his customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora Fátima C. se destaca como excelente comerciante porque vende perecederos como lo son frutas y verduras todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana en el mercado.

Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras como mandarinas, naranjas, naranja agria, y limones para proceder a su venta y de esta manera obtener el ingreso para invertir en el negocio y por ende beneficiar a su familia compuesta por sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Fátima C. stands out as an excellent merchant because she sells perishables like fruites and vegetables every day, starting very early in the morning, in Managua's Mayoreo market. She is asking for funds to buy fruits and vegetables like: mandarin oranges, oranges, sour oranges and lemons to continue with her sales thus earning income to invest in her business and benefit her family, which consists of three children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua B. is married and has two children. She has not received any form of education. Akosua is a seamstress, selling clothing materials and beans as well at Jukwa. Her husband is a commercial driver. Akosua’s income is used to help her husband maintain the welfare of their home. Akosua will use her loan to purchase more clothing materials and other sewing supplies to sew for her demanding customers. With the new income from her expanded business, Akosua plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua S. is married and has two children. She attained a junior high school level of education. Efua sells locally manufactured salt at Jukwa market. Her husband is a farmer. Efua uses her income to help her husband take care of the family. Efua will use the loan she will be receiving to purchase more salt and secondhand clothing (which will serve as an additional trade) for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, Efua plans to save to buy a shop for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more salt and secondhand clothing

loans.name: Douglas Manuel

texts.es:
Este joven se llama Douglas Manuel B. Cano, tiene 41años de edad, casado, Obrero, él trabaja para una empresa donde se elaboran rones, en esta empresa tiene siete de laborar, su esposa es Ama de Casa, tiene tres hijos, dos mujeres y un varón que es el menor, la mayor ya saco sus estudios técnicos, la otra mujercita está en escuela secundaria y el menor en escuela primaria.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de cuatro créditos, los que le han servido para realizar mejoras en su vivienda y este último para compra de utensilios y electrodomésticos para él hogar, vale mencionar que en los cuatro créditos otorgados anteriormente, este joven  ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
This young man is Douglas Manuel B. Cano. He's a 41-year-old, married, laborer. He has been employed at a rum distillery for the past seven years. His wife is a housewife; they have three children, two girls and one boy, who is the youngest. His oldest daughter has finished a technical career while his middle daughter is still in secondary school and their son is in elementary school. He has had four loans with our institution that he's used to make home improvements. This last loan will be used to buy utensils and home appliances. It's worth mentioning that this young man has been very responsible with his obligations related to his previous four loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy utensils and home appliances (A bed and a stove)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is married and stays with her two children. She has received senior high education. Mary is a hairdresser and sells fabrics as an additional trade in Jukwa. The materials are displayed in front of her shop. She has been in this business for about three years now. Her husband works with a local car station. Mary uses income from her sales to help her husband with the payment of rent and school fees. Mary will use the loan she hopes to get, to purchase more varieties of hair products for her salon and materials for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save to reinvest in business.

loans.use: To purchase hair products and fabric for resale

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr: Y. Marcelline est née le 05 octobre 1960 dans la commune de sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Cela fait déjà 15 ans que Marcelline vit à Sainte-Rita, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à GBEGBO Athanase, Marcelline est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Marcelline vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage ensemble les charges familiales. Pour participer aux dépenses de la famille, Marcelline vend du charbon de bois à son domicile. C’est à l’intérieur du Bénin que Marcelline effectue ses achats. Marcelline n’a pas été à l’école mais exerce son activité depuis un moment. C’est la première fois que Marcelline sollicite un crédit chez ALIDé. Ce crédit permettra à Marcelline de diversifier ses activités.
texts.en:
Y. Marcelline was born in November 5, 1960 in the town Sèmè-Podji, Benin.  She has been living in Sainte-Rita, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for fifteen years.  Married to GBEGBO Athanase, she is the mother of five children, who have all attended school.  She lives with her husband and children.  Together, the couple share in covering family expenses.  To take part in meeting family expenses, Marcelline sells charcoal out of her home.  She makes her purchases in Benin's interior.  She did not attend school but has been operating her business for a while now.  This is the first time she is requesting a loan from ALIDé.  This loan will enable her to diversify her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Siste

texts.en: Siste E. sells locally produced metal cooking utensils and plastic containers at Jukwa. E. has not received any form of education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is an aluminum pot maker. She helps her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more plastic products in addition to the utensils she sells. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more plastic products (in addition to utensils)

loans.name: Mintonneyesso

texts.fr: A. Mintonneyesso est née vers 1976 à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique. Mintonneyesso vit depuis 30 ans au quartier Ahito à Allada. Mariée à KAKPO Jules, un chauffeur, Mintonneyesso est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Mintonneyesso vend de la nourriture (haricot préparé) à Allada. C’est également à Allada que Mintonneyesso s’approvisionne. Mintonneyesso exerce cette activité depuis 15 ans et a déjà obtenu deux prêts de ALIDé, prêts qu’elle a bien remboursés. Dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’accroître sa production journalière, Mintonneyesso sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Mintonneyesso A. was born in 1976 in Allada, in the Atlantique department. For 30 years she has lived in the Ahito neighborhood of Allada. She is married to Jules Kakpo, a driver, and has one child who is in school. The couple both work to pay the family's expenses. To meet their needs, Mintonneyessoo sells food (prepared beans) in Allada. That is also where she buys her supplies. She has been in business for 15 years and has already gotten two loans from Alidé, which she paid back in full. To increase her working capital and her daily production, Mintonneyesso is requesting a third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two bowls of beans and condiments.

loans.name: Ginette

texts.fr: Née en 1983 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique, A. Ginette est mariée à AHOVEGBE Désiré, un soudeur. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Ahito à Allada, depuis trois ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Ginette vend depuis trois ans, des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique à Allada. Ginette a bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Ginette désire renforcer son activité et augmenter son stock de produits, afin de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle. C’est pour cette raison que Ginette sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Ginette A. was borin in 1983 in Allada in the Atlantique department. She is married to Désiré Ahovegbe, who is a welder. The couple has two children who are both in school. The family has lived in the Ahito neighborhood of Allada for three years. She and her husband both work to pay for their family's various expenses. To meet her needs, for three years Ginette has been selling plastic kitchen utensils in Allada. She has previously been granted two loans by Alidé, which she paid back in full. Ginette would like to strengthen her business and increase her stock of products to better meet her customers' demand. For this reason Ginette is requesting a third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua A. is a seamstress. She also operates a chop bar and in this bar she sells soft drinks and a variety of food. She has people who manage the chop bar for her. She spends most of her time sewing at Jukwa. Akua has attained senior high level of education. She is a single parent. Akua has been in the sewing business for about eight years. She is responsible for both her own and her daughter’s welfare. Her loan will be used to buy sewing supplies and more soft drinks to sell at her chop bar to meet the demand. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her child.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and more soft drinks to sell at her chop bar

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: Née le 12 Décembre 1962 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique, K. Georgette vit depuis 40 ans au quartier Ahito à Allada. Georgette est une veuve et mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge. Georgette vit donc seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs charges. Georgette a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Georgette mène comme activité la vente d’agoutis et d’escargots à Allada. C'est aussi à Allada que Georgette achète ses produits. Georgette a bénéficié déjà d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. En vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Georgette sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Georgette K. was born on December 12th, 1962 in Allada in the Atlantique department. For 40 years she has been living in the Ahito neighborhood of Allada. Georgette is a widow and the mother of five children, all in school, three of whom are still dependent on her. She thus lives alone with her children and pays their expenses on her own. Georgette went to school until the secondary level. To meet her needs, Georgette sells agoutis and snails in Allada. She also buys her products there. She has already been granted one loan from Alidé, which she paid back in full. To increase her stock and thus her sales, Georgette is requesting a second loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 400 snails and 5 agoutis.

loans.name: Nidia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Esta Sra. se llama Nidia del Carmen O. Mendoza, tiene 49 años de edad, soltera, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, el marido es obrero y trabaja en una empresa donde se produce Azúcar, ella tiene cuatro hijos, tres mujeres y un varón, ninguno de ellos depende de ella. 

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de Veinte y Siete créditos, los que le han servido en su gran mayoría para realizar compra de mercadería, vale mencionar que en los Veinte y Seis créditos  otorgados anteriormente, ella ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Nidia del Carmen Oporto Mendoza, 49, is single; she is a tortilla merchant. Her husband is a laborer employed by a sugar refinery. She has four children; three girls and one boy, none of whom still depend on her. He has had twenty-seven loans with our institution that, for the most part, have been used to buy merchandise. It is important to mention that she has been very responsible with her obligations in all prior twenty-seven loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her business (Corn, Firewood, Lime powder)

loans.name: María Haydee

texts.es:
En el Mercado Iván Montenegro en Managua, la señora María Haydee S. tiene su propia pulpería o distribuidora que atiende a diario desde muy temprano ofreciendo todo tipo de productos principalmente productos comestibles que vende en su localidad.

Actualmente ella está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de comestibles como queso, cuajada y crema por la razón de que actualmente se le ha agotado y necesita continuar ofertándolo en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
María Haydee S. has her own grocery store in Managua's Iván Montenegro market. She is open for business daily from very early in the morning and stocks all kinds of products, primarily food items. She is asking for funding to buy food items like: cheese, cuajada (milk curd), and cream because she has run out of these items and needs to continue stocking them in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock dairy products.

loans.name: María Elpidia

texts.es:
La señora Elpidia Martinez se destaca por ser muy trabajadora porque a diario vende refrescos en el mercado Mayoreo elaborándolos con gran calidad y mucho entusiasmo ya que ella anhela seguir mejorando las condiciones de su actividad y por ende las condiciones de su familia.

El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar, bolsas, pajillas, cebada, semilla de jícaro y frutas para continuar elaborando los refrescos que le gusta mucho a las personas en el mercado.
texts.en:
Elpidia M. stands out as being very hard-working because she sells home-made beverages daily in the Mayoreo market. She makes them with much enthusiasm and good quality because she aims to continue improving her business thus her family's living conditions. She is asking for funds to buy sugar, plastic bags, drinking straws, barley, jícaro (a native tree) seeds (used to brew horchata) and fruits to continue manufacturing the beverages that are so well-liked by people in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her beverages.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, el señor Aristides Martinez se dedica a la venta de productos varios tales como anteojos, calculadoras, mochilas, cadenas, calculadoras, entre otros productos.

Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos varios para continuar comercializándolos y de esta manera satisfacer a sus clientes y obtener los ingresos para el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida. Espera que el crédito le sea otorgado para invertirlo a lo inmediato en la compra de estos productos.
texts.en:
Aristides M. sells assorted merchandise like: sunglasses, calculators, knapsacks, chains, etc. in Managua's Mayoreo market. He is asking for funds to buy these products in order to continue to sell them thereby meeting customer demand and earning income to improve his standard of living. He hopes the loan will be approved so that he can immediately invest in stock merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Santos Hermogenes

texts.es:
Este Sr. Se llama Santos Hermogenes B. Téllez, tiene 49 años de edad, casado, es soltero, él se dedica a la venta de helados, en este negocio se desempeña desde hace 17 años, de  tiene un hijo varón que tiene Dieciséis años de edad y está estudiando la escuela secundaria.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de Veinte y Cinco créditos, en su mayoría los ha sacado para gastos del negocio, esta vez lo necesita para mejorar su vivienda.

Vale mencionar que en los Veinticuatro créditos otorgados anteriormente, este señor ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Santos Hermogenes B. Téllez, 49, is married. He has sold ice-cream for the past 17 years. He has a 16-year-old son who is in secondary school. He has had 25 previous loans with our institution; most of which have been used to stock his business. This time, however, he needs funds to make home improvements. It is worth mentioning that he has been responsible with his obligations in all his previous 24 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Nicolasa Aracelly

texts.es:
Esta joven se llama Nicolasa Aracelly G. Meza, tiene 27 años de edad, es casado, ella habita con su marido en una comunidad Rural que se llama Sirama Sur de donde ambos son originarios, su marido trabaja en una compañía donde se elaboran rones, ella tiene un  hijo que tiene dos años.

Ella se dedica al destace de cerdos, a demás de vender la carne, vende otros sub productos del cerdo como Chicharrón, Pepena, Rebano, Frito, Nacatamal, con estos ingresos ella aporta con los ingresos del hogar.

Con nuestra institución ella ha obtenido la cantidad de Veinte y Cuatro créditos, los que en su mayoría han sido para capital de trabajo.

Es bueno hacer mención que en los Veinte y Cuatro créditos otorgados anteriormente a esta joven, ella ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
This young woman is Nicolasa Aracelly G. Meza. She is 27 years old, married, and lives with her husband in a rural community, called Sirama Sur, which is where they are both from. Her husband works at a rum distillery and they have a two-year-old son. She butchers pigs and, besides selling the pork meat, she also sells other pork products like: chicharrón (fried pork skin), pepena (pork intestine), nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales). Earnings from these sales are used to meet household expenses. She has had 24 loans with our institution; most of them have been for working capital. It is worth mentioning that this young woman has been very responsible with all her previous loan obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and ingredients.

loans.name: Félix Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Félix trabaja como vigilante para una empresa ganadera donde ya tiene tres años de laborar para ellos el es un obrero que con esfuerzo propio ha logrado salir adelante ya que con los pocos recursos que posee y los prestamos brindado por ceprodel ha mejorado su vivienda ya que anteriormente esta casa estaba cubierta de plástico y ahora es de piedra de concreto con lo cual le brinda mayor seguridad a su familia.
Este crédito lo solicita para gastos personales ya que lo necesita para la compra de una nevera el cual es de mucha utilidad
texts.en:
Félix is employed as a watchman at a cattle firm; he has been there for three years. He is a laborer who has managed to get ahead in life through his own efforts in that his meager resources and loans from Ceprodel have made it possible for him to improve his home. It used to be roofed with plastic sheeting and now it's made of stone and concrete which provides better security for his family. He is asking for funds to buy a refrigerator that will be very useful.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Mónica Alexandra

texts.es:
Mónica C. de 42 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Su esposo trabaja como chofer ellos tienen un hijo de 19 años. 

Debido a la desesperante idea de Mónica de tener su propio negocio decidió invertir sus ahorros en sabanas y cortinas, poco a poco empezó a comprar al por mayor debido a la demanda que tenia. 

Ahora ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde vende sabanas, cortinas, cobijas, etc. Trabaja todos los días y también vende las sabanas recorriendo el centro de Guayaquil. Con el préstamo quiere comprar sabanas, edredones, cobertores para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere tener su propio local y tenerlo bien surtido.
texts.en:
Mónica C., aged 42, lives in a peri-urban marginalized area of Guayaquil. Her house is made of concrete and the only basic services available to her are electricity and water. Her husband works as a driver. They have a 19-year-old son. Because Mónica desperately wanted to have her own business, she decided to invest her savings in sheets and curtains. Gradually she began to buy in bulk due to the demand she had. Now she has a small room in her house where she sells sheets, curtains, blankets, etc. She works every day and also travels to downtown Guayaquil to sell her sheets. Mónica wants to use her loan to buy sheets, comforters and bedspreads for her store. In future she wants to have her own premises and keep them well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Marianela

texts.en:
Marianela is a single mother of two who lives in San Jose, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. The loan consultant who has been working with Marianela has described her as a hardworking entrepreneur with a fighting spirit. She has taken part in capacity building classes (offered by the government) in floral design, which have helped her a great deal.

Marianela has a business selling catalogue items in her community. From door to door, she offers her clients various products including clothing, shoes and cosmetics, among others. 

Marienela´s family has been complicated as a result of the separation of she and her husband. She has taken on the responsibilities of raising her children independently. She hopes to use this loan to increase her working capital and her sales in an effort to improve living conditions at home.

This will be Marianela´s second loan with Fundación Mujer.

loans.use: To purchase catalogue products to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 56-year-old mother of four. She lives with her husband, their two children, two grandchildren and the wife of one of their sons in Alajuelita, a region located in Costa Rica´s central valley. Angelita is an experienced client of Fundación Mujer. Over the past 16 years, she has received numerous loans in various amounts to finance her sales business. Angelita plans to use the current loan to purchase clothes, shoes and perfumes, which she will sell to her clients in different parts of Costa Rica. The majority of her clients are women, though she offers products for men as well. Angelita does not drive; her main method of transportation is the public bus system.  

In the mornings, Angelita performs domestic tasks such as cooking, cleaning and overall house maintenance. After lunch, she heads out to either purchase new products, collect on repayments from clients she has sold to on credit or to sell her products. Twice per month, Angelita travels 3 hours by bus to an area named Guapiles to visit her clients. 

Angelita says that the apartment her family lives in is small for seven people.  At the moment, she is saving as much as she can so that one day, she might be able to buy a house in Alajuelita.  Angelita says her main problem is collecting money from some of her clients. She says she has to remind some of them that her products are ¨not a gift.¨

loans.use: To purchase clothing, shoes and perfumes.

loans.name: Aleyda De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Aleyda, vive en el barrio Memorial Sandino, de edad de 36 años, con una hija el cual estudia, su esposo es cadete de Taxi. La señora Aleyda trabaja desde hace varios años como domestica, para poder apoyar su esposo con los gastos, ya que todo esta caro y hacen falta muchas cosas por hacer en su pequeña casa. Las dificultades en su trabajo es que su salario es poco y el trabajo es mucho. Con este financiamiento quiere cambiar el techo ya que esta en mal estado y desea hacerlo ante del invierno. Comprara materiales de construcción y comenzara la obra. Que será de gran beneficio para su familia en poder tener mejor comodidad. Sus planes es lograr encontrar un trabajo que le paguen mejor para poder ayudarse económicamente. Es por eso para ella es importante la educación de su hija para que logré mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Aleyda, 36, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood with her daughter, who is a student, and her husband, who is a taxi driver. She has worked as a domestic employee for several years to help her husband meet household expenses since everything is expensive and they still need a lot done to their small house. A problem with her job is that the salary is low and the work load is high. She will use the funds to replace her roof because it’s in poor condition and she wants to replace it before winter. She will buy building materials and supplies to begin the project, which will be of great benefit to her family by providing increased comfort. Her plans are to manage to find a better job where her salary is higher so that she can help herself financially. This is why she considers her daughter’s education so very important: so that she will have better employment opportunities. .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting.

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en:
Lagi P. is 32 and married with 3 children (ages 2 - 6).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Lagi has 2 years of experience in this business.  Lagi needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Lagi joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Lagi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Yesenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Yesenia T. tiene su propio establecimiento de venta de especies en el Mercado Mayoreo donde vende todo tipo de especies tales como canela, duilces, tamarindo, pimienta, mostaza, salsas, entre otros.

El crédito que ella está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de las especies para ser comercializadas y de esta manera obtener los ingresos pertinentes para el sustento de su negocio y de su hogar que ella posee.
texts.en:
Yesenia T. sells spices like, cinnamon, tamarind, pepper, mustard, sauces, etc. in the Mayoreo market. She is asking for funding to buy spices to sell so that she can continue to earn income to maintain her business and her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spices.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora Ana María S. se dedica a la venta de verduras y abarrotes en su localidad donde todos los días llega desde las cinco de la mañana al tramo debido a que ella es una mujer muy trabajadora.

Actualmente está solicitando el crédito para la compra de las verduras como lo son tomates cebollas, chiltomas, remolacha, zanahorias, repollo y también comprará otros productos como son huevos, mortadela, entre otros.

Ella requiere la compra de estos productos y para ello solicita el crédito esperando que le sea otorgado para proceder con dicha compra para ofertarlo en su localidad.
texts.en:
Ana María S. sells groceries and vegetables in her sales stall in Managua's Mayoreo market every day; she opens for business at 5am because she's a very hard-working woman. She is asking for funding to buy vegetables like: tomatoes, onions, peppers, beets, carrots, cabbage, as well as other products like: eggs and mortadela (bologna sausage), among others. She needs to buy these products and requires funding to do so; she hopes that the loan will be approved so that she can proceed with said purchase and be able to offer the products for sale at her location.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and groceries.

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Norma M. vende verduras en el Mercado Mayoreo todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana destacándose como una dama muy trabajadora que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de su negocio en su localidad.

Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de algunas verduras como tamarindo, ayote, yuca, quequisque y otros. Espera que el crédito le sea otorgado para a lo inmediato comprar dichos productos para beneficio de ella y su negocio.
texts.en:
Every day, starting very early in the morning, Norma M. sells vegetables in the Mayoreo Market. She is known as a hardworking woman who is always dedicated to the success of her business. Currently, she is seeking a loan that she plans to invest in the purchase of vegetables, such as tamarind, squash, cassava (yuca), yautia and others. She hopes that the loan would be granted so that she could quickly purchase the aforementioned products in order to improve her business and her livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Ymca

texts.en:
YMCA  R. is 32 and married with 2 children (ages 1 and 3).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  YMCA  has 1 year of experience in this business.  YMCA needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, YMCA  joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are YMCA's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Leticia Jackeline

texts.es: La señora Leticia, es una mujer trabajadora, se dedica al trabajo de la costura, con 55 años de edad, su negocio lo inicio con fondos propios que dio su esposo producto de su trabajo el cual se desempeña en un taller de mecánica. Juntos apoyan a sus hijos para que logren una mejor educación. De los cinco hijos tres trabajan. La señora Leticia también vende pollo, huevo para obtener mejores ingresos ya que se vende mucho, es por eso la necesidad de comprar un freezer para aumentar las ventas ya que solo depende de una mantenedora, el cual no le alcanza la cantidad de pollo, ya que también tiene una variedad de productos, es por eso comprara el freezer para ser utilizado con la venta de pollo. Contenta con esta inversión ya que es de gran utilidad y beneficio de su negocio. Sus planes a futuro es poder hacer las mejoras a su casa, cambiar las tablas por pared de concreto el cual espera lograrlo a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Leticia is 55 years old. She is a hardworking woman who started her own sewing business with the funds provided by her husband from his work in an auto repair shop. Together, Leticia and her husband support their five children, providing them with a better education. Three of their children are working. To increase her income, Leticia also sells chicken and eggs. The sales are brisk; hence Leticia's need to purchase a freezer. Right now, she only has one refrigerator and doesn't have the space to stock enough chicken. She also has a variety of other products, and thus she plans to buy a freezer which will be used for the sale of chicken. She is happy about this investment since it will greatly improve her business. In the future, she plans to do renovations in her house; she would like to replace a wooden partition with a concrete wall. She hopes to be able to do these improvements soon.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a freezer to increase her chicken sales.

Lusa is a client wishes to develop her business and assist her family financially.

In 2009, Lusa joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Lusa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es: Es un grupo de personas conformada por 3 integrantes, como presidenta se encuentra la señora Juana A. C., el cual esta señora cuenta con 2 hijos, y sus oficios son la elaboración de canastillas de plasticos,vive con su esposo, ella trabaja para que pueda ayudar a su esposo a mejorar sus condiciones economicas, actualmente necesita un prestamo, ya que necesita ampliar su Capital de Trabajo, por lo que se acerco a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de Pologuá,  para realiar su respectivo tramite, conjuntamente con las pesonas que integran el grupo.
texts.en:
There are three members in this group. Juana A. C. is the president of the group. She lives with her husband and has two children. Juana makes plastic baskets; she works so that she could help her husband improve their living standards. She is currently asking for a loan because she needs to increase her working capital. For this reason, Juana and other members of the group approached asociación ASDIR de Pologuá, seeking to obtain the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital.

loans.name: Faleala

texts.en:

Faleala needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Tamalika needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.
